revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-23 07:27:08.000000000', 'message': 'TripleO: Do not use an independent content provide job

The tripleo-puppet-standalone template introduces a content provider
job and a subsequent job to use containers built by the content
provider job. This is inefficient because we run only a single tripleo
job.

Change-Id: Idb5b832d3243fd32b7d48615c7f41f96ce9054b8
(cherry picked from commit 49dcf5846765a0ed07e06409ad9a19a851fdc959)

commit_message:
TripleO: Do not use an independent content provide job

The tripleo-puppet-standalone template introduces a content provider
job and a subsequent job to use containers built by the content
provider job. This is inefficient because we run only a single tripleo
job.

Change-Id: Idb5b832d3243fd32b7d48615c7f41f96ce9054b8
(cherry picked from commit 49dcf5846765a0ed07e06409ad9a19a851fdc959)

nodes roles.

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

Change-Id: Ia28f458ac84e4f46dcda0dd800276bbd5721a568
(cherry picked from commit 56c1954629b78921ca9e8347ca7fd77f1d588062)

commit_message:
Expose vhost_custom_fragment

It is provided by the Puppet class 'openstacklib::wsgi::apache'.
This change exposes it for the Cinder service.

Change-Id: If3f3f230aae7e04a774c967e1786561d70e43e50
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1fa7a69e9b9300c1c228f872ba3e37f0210f17dd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 09:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Skip encryption metadata lookups if secret already exists on host

When connecting an encrypted volume to a host the _attach_encryptor
method will be called in order to either call a legacy os-brick
encryptor *or* configure a libvirt secret used by libvirt and QEMU to
natively decrypt LUKSv1 encrypted volumes. To create this libvirt secret
the configured key manager will be queried to provide and then decode
the associated secret before this is stashed within libvirt.

This change simply skips the above when an existing libvirt secret
associated with the target volume is found on the host already.

While this obviously optimises basic instance lifecycle flows such as a
simple power off and on it additionally resolves a more convoluted use
case when the ``[DEFAULT]/resume_guests_state_on_host_boot``
configurable is enabled. In this case the compute service has no request
context with which to query the key manager when attempting to restart
instances with encrypted volumes attached. As a result any attempt by
the compute service to restart an instance with an attached encrypted
volume would previously fail.

Closes-Bug: #1905701
Change-Id: Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip encryption metadata lookups if secret already exists on host

When connecting an encrypted volume to a host the _attach_encryptor
method will be called in order to either call a legacy os-brick
encryptor *or* configure a libvirt secret used by libvirt and QEMU to
natively decrypt LUKSv1 encrypted volumes. To create this libvirt secret
the configured key manager will be queried to provide and then decode
the associated secret before this is stashed within libvirt.

This change simply skips the above when an existing libvirt secret
associated with the target volume is found on the host already.

While this obviously optimises basic instance lifecycle flows such as a
simple power off and on it additionally resolves a more convoluted use
case when the ``[DEFAULT]/resume_guests_state_on_host_boot``
configurable is enabled. In this case the compute service has no request
context with which to query the key manager when attempting to restart
instances with encrypted volumes attached. As a result any attempt by
the compute service to restart an instance with an attached encrypted
volume would previously fail.

Closes-Bug: #1905701
Change-Id: Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a
(cherry picked from commit a107a5099e86c3da80a6feeca6f840d5a3ad11b9)
(cherry picked from commit eda11a4875ff30b8c3103475421ace3ebd440e4a)

commit_message:
Remove references to 'sys.version_info'

We support Python 3.6 as a minimum now, making these checks no-ops.

Change-Id: Iee9fa15ae54e359b336afa565c1cf3bece29ab2c

commit_message:
Move ceph_admin_extra_vars logic to tripleo-ansible

Instead of creating ceph_admin_extra_vars with
distribute_private_key always set to true, set
that variable to true only when appropriate based
on logic in the depends-on patch.

Also, it is not necessary to override the values of
tripleo_admin_generate_key or ssh_servers to create
the ceph-admin user for cephadm.

Related-Bug: #1928717
Depends-On: I8343c419c140670f01bdc94b4c8130004bac64e1
Change-Id: I2bacf82f85e5c78f5ae603460919cf3ff7130e9c
(cherry picked from commit 9fb6b36f14cc3dc298a71f069ece78b0276c97bc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-30 19:30:36.000000000', 'message': "Add support for direct ports with QoS in OVS

Today OVS mechanism driver can bind Direct port see [1] for OVS hardware
offloads.
OVS was extended with tc-offload to support rate limit see [2].
The OVS QoS driver [3] is limited to work only with Normal Ports, so we
can't put QoS rules on direct port.
This patch proposes to add support in OVS QoS driver for direct ports.
The mechanism to enforce such policies is the same with normal and
hardware offloaded direct ports.

[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e7f6ba220e10c0b560da097185514b6e33e2dc71
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3b074128ca91ba335bd8ef9db8dfe00fda51a63d/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/mech_openvswitch.py#L83
[3] - https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3b074128ca91ba335bd8ef9db8dfe00fda51a63d/neutron/services/qos/drivers/openvswitch/driver.py#L56

Change-Id: I24b5cd6c022e479080fc84e4c445c9cddfc88e38
Closes-Bug: #1843165
(cherry picked from commit 12089a526e25cfe5ccb8b4da86b653970d75f14a)

commit_message:
Add support for direct ports with QoS in OVS

Today OVS mechanism driver can bind Direct port see [1] for OVS
hardware offloads.

OVS was extended with tc-offload to support rate limit see [2].
The OVS QoS driver [3] is limited to work only with Normal Ports, so we
can't put QoS rules on direct port.
This patch proposes to add support in OVS QoS driver for direct ports.
The mechanism to enforce such policies is the same with normal and
hardware offloaded direct ports.

[1]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e7f6ba220e10c0b560da097185514b6e33e2dc71
[2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3b074128ca91ba335bd8ef9db8dfe00fda51a63d/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/mech_openvswitch.py#L83
[3]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3b074128ca91ba335bd8ef9db8dfe00fda51a63d/neutron/services/qos/drivers/openvswitch/driver.py#L56

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py

Change-Id: I24b5cd6c022e479080fc84e4c445c9cddfc88e38
Closes-Bug: #1843165
(cherry picked from commit 12089a526e25cfe5ccb8b4da86b653970d75f14a)

commit_message:
libvirt: pin edk2-ovmf for CentOS Stream

edk2-ovmf introduced a bug [1] and results in libvirt/qemu errors:

    libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unknown feature amd-sev-es

It's going to be fixed in the next rebase to libvirt 7.4.0 - but let's
pin for now.

This affects CI and test environments using the
bifrost-create-vm-nodes role.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1961558#c10

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/793349

Change-Id: I40f018715b3a6c061039f6cd29f6acb254182685

commit_message:
libvirt: pin edk2-ovmf for CentOS Stream

edk2-ovmf introduced a bug [1] and results in libvirt/qemu errors:

    libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unknown feature amd-sev-es

It's going to be fixed in the next rebase to libvirt 7.4.0 - but let's
pin for now.

This affects CI and test environments using the
bifrost-create-vm-nodes role.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1961558#c10

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/793348

Change-Id: I40f018715b3a6c061039f6cd29f6acb254182685

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I34789f52da45bb169d76b822208c05e53d8984de

commit_message:
Moving tripleo train job to non-voting

TripleO is working to fix the tempest package issue with this job.
Meanwhile, moving it to non-voting in order to not block other patches.

Change-Id: I411d9d22ee95eda45e70f149563e509e8766ec73

Deprecate panko, python-pankoclient and puppet-panko

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I1f3746d04f1d339709db2d06d5af1158a39ebd0c

subject: Revert "Add support for JUnitXML output (optional)"
messages:
[{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-05-27 15:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-05-27 15:18:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I find this a bit weird. The original patch have been approved by core reviewers and no objections have been raised.

The commit message doesn't explain which requirements are fullfilled (as I requested the feature in the first place, I think I should know them and the generated files are correct).

Moreover, I find it a bit tasteless to just revert without even asking "we found out there are some bits missing, would you please add the missing bits, what do you think?".

Sorry but no. If this is the way tripleo-validations work, I'm going to recommend everyone to not use it and find alternative solutions for testing.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-05-27 15:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

Ongoing conversations on #tripleo on freenode indicate there will be a path forward without this revert; let's communicate well folks and make sure we achieve common goals

Thank you to both Jiri and Luigi for their understanding and patience here."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-05-27 15:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

This reverts commit efca0653aaeeceb522416eb3326eae11e3617187.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 09:29:08.000000000', 'message': 'Adding the missing HostDomain config option

The ``HostDomain`` config type have been added few months ago [1]
however the config option have been forgotten and this new type
isn't importable.

When we try to import this type without defining a new related cfg
option we get the following issue:

```
AttributeError: module 'oslo_config.cfg' has no attribute 'HostDomain'
```

These changes allow us to import this new type and allow us to use
it in our configs:

```
>>> from oslo_config import cfg
>>> foo = cfg.HostDomain('foo')
>>> foo.type.__call__("1")
...
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "~/oslo.config/oslo_config/types.py", line 893, in __call__
     raise ValueError(
ValueError: 1 is not a valid host address
>>> foo.type.__call__("host_name")
'host_name'
```

Also properly initialize HostDomain because The HostDomain class wasn't
calling super in it's __init__() method, which resulted in the type_name not
being set properly for instances of that class.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75

Change-Id: Ie947803f61ba0ef080018e0447de894a400d7975
Closes-Bug: 1924283
(cherry picked from commit 1074937e84a5d2b8f356260d4cc54497ee95cfe8)
'}, {'created': '2021-05-19 13:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'Adding the missing HostDomain config option

(cherry picked from commit 1074937e84a5d2b8f356260d4cc54497ee95cfe8)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding the missing HostDomain config option

The ``HostDomain`` config type have been added few months ago [1]
however the config option have been forgotten and this new type
isn't importable.

When we try to import this type without defining a new related cfg
option we get the following issue:

```
AttributeError: module 'oslo_config.cfg' has no attribute 'HostDomain'
```

These changes allow us to import this new type and allow us to use
it in our configs:

```
>>> from oslo_config import cfg
>>> foo = cfg.HostDomain('foo')
>>> foo.type.__call__("1")
...
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "~/oslo.config/oslo_config/types.py", line 893, in __call__
     raise ValueError(
ValueError: 1 is not a valid host address
>>> foo.type.__call__("host_name")
'host_name'
```

Also properly initialize HostDomain because The HostDomain class wasn't
calling super in it's __init__() method, which resulted in the type_name not
being set properly for instances of that class.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75

Change-Id: Ie947803f61ba0ef080018e0447de894a400d7975
Closes-Bug: 1924283
(cherry picked from commit 1074937e84a5d2b8f356260d4cc54497ee95cfe8)

commit_message:
Remove [octavia]/base_url option from neutron.conf

This configuration option was only used by neutron-lbaas, which is now
retired. It should have been added to neutron_lbaas.conf.j2 instead.

Change-Id: Iba591473abf4304413eca0d84e0b2be197c527fc

commit_message:
Allow lazy load in model_query

Lazy load may be useful for performance if some fields
are not always required in all cases.
This will be used in network and port list operations
to override default joined and subquery loading.

Change-Id: Ibc3b9ffd01fe9eeb6a78671bd286ae3ade8816fa

[{'created': '2021-05-24 11:58:40.000000000', 'message': "Limit cephadm private key distribution to mons/mgrs

It is not necessary to distribute the ceph-admin user's
private SSH key to every host of a Ceph service; only
the hosts running the ceph_mgr and ceph_mon services
need the private key. By default this is limited to
the controller nodes only.

The existing role calls the ceph-admin-user-playbook.yml.
Split it into two calls which use --limit to target the
necessary Ceph service hosts and set distribute_private_key
to true only for mons/mgrs.

Closes-Bug: #1928717
Change-Id: I8343c419c140670f01bdc94b4c8130004bac64e1
(cherry picked from commit 4d3144fce380300b9f1ab3f00ed816c1fb055367)
"}]
commit_message:
Limit cephadm private key distribution to mons/mgrs

It is not necessary to distribute the ceph-admin user's
private SSH key to every host of a Ceph service; only
the hosts running the ceph_mgr and ceph_mon services
need the private key. By default this is limited to
the controller nodes only.

The existing role calls the ceph-admin-user-playbook.yml.
Split it into two calls which use --limit to target the
necessary Ceph service hosts and set distribute_private_key
to true only for mons/mgrs.

Closes-Bug: #1928717
Change-Id: I8343c419c140670f01bdc94b4c8130004bac64e1
(cherry picked from commit 4d3144fce380300b9f1ab3f00ed816c1fb055367)

messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-05-27 10:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-05-27 13:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/793373/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 45m 14s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 10:49:02.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: make cross cell resize spawn from snapshot image

During a cross cell resize, we do an instance snapshot and
then we spawn() instance back on target cell.

Unfortunately, we mistakenly spawn back the instance to its original
image id, instead of using freshly created snapshot_id.

The change proposes to update instance.image_ref with snapshot_id
in order that spawn()->_create_image() uses it and set back
instance.image_ref after.

Note that for qcow2 backend case, we also need to rebase disk image
with its original backing file to avoid mismatch between
instance.image_ref and backing file, as we currently do in unshelve
context.

Change-Id: I0b81282eba8238d8b64a67e38cf9d6392de1f85c
Closes-Bug: #1906428
(cherry picked from commit f02899418db9fa118a7bd0c813446b8dce51b7d7)
(cherry picked from commit 9c0acadffdf5dba40f3b9070a67fa30fedf18d23)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: make cross cell resize spawn from snapshot image

During a cross cell resize, we do an instance snapshot and
then we spawn() instance back on target cell.

Unfortunately, we mistakenly spawn back the instance to its original
image id, instead of using freshly created snapshot_id.

The change proposes to update instance.image_ref with snapshot_id
in order that spawn()->_create_image() uses it and set back
instance.image_ref after.

Note that for qcow2 backend case, we also need to rebase disk image
with its original backing file to avoid mismatch between
instance.image_ref and backing file, as we currently do in unshelve
context.

Change-Id: I0b81282eba8238d8b64a67e38cf9d6392de1f85c
Closes-Bug: #1906428
(cherry picked from commit f02899418db9fa118a7bd0c813446b8dce51b7d7)
(cherry picked from commit 9c0acadffdf5dba40f3b9070a67fa30fedf18d23)

commit_message:
CI: Fix libvirt errors caused by latest edk2-ovmf

Some CentOS Stream CI jobs started to fail when defining VMs with:

    libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unknown feature amd-sev-es

This was introduced by edk2-ovmf-20200602gitca407c7246bf-5.el8.noarch.
This change excludes this package version in Zuul jobs, which fixes the
kayobe-seed-vm-centos8s job.

Overcloud centos8s jobs were also broken by the nova-libvirt Kolla image
containing this package, which is used by Tenks. Updated images using
the previous version of edk2-ovmf [1][2] are now available from quay.io.

This also needs to be fixed for Kayobe and Tenks in general, unless a
new package is released soon.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/792999
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/793174

Change-Id: I5bc8197143ce763cdaf8a9ac0b782b524d5df258

commit_message:
Get rid of the $pyvers variable

Since everyone has switched to Python3, it's time for the removal of the
$pyvers variable.

Change-Id: Id4d8b8cb808b3724ccc146691cde2d4605afe72a

commit_message:
Fix invalid/deleted members in haproxy config file

Fix the member list in the haproxy configuration files, it prevents
DELETED members to be in the list.

This patch is specific to the stable/train branch. The fix for other
releases was introduced in stable/ussuri but it is part of a patch
(Ic44019b8877f008e6d7a75ceed1b7fd958e051d0) that is not backportable to
stable/train. Only the diffs related to the jinja templates have been
included in this new commit.

One part of the fix was already backported to stable/train in
Ib7b083e1dfbfd7afcca870ed6f60a871b2e19253

Story 2008871
Task 42402

Change-Id: I4c85425a774594c52a0bb743fd5b787706201425

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 18:59:25.000000000', 'message': 'Limit qemu-img execution arenas

qemu-img attempts to launch multiple threads by default *and*
attempts to have multiple memory allocation arenas to operate
from. While multithreading can be good for performance, this
pattern and the memory footprint for process launch and
dependencies can turn the memory footprint for a cirros image
conversion (16MB) into 1.2GB of memory being asked for by the
qemu-img tool.

In order to limit this impact, as the default number of arenas
is governed by the number of CPUs times the number 8, it seems
reasonable to lower this to a more reasonable number which
also helps keep our possible memory footprint from being exceeded.

Change-Id: I71a28ec59ec31c691205eb34d9fcab63a2ccb682
Story: 2008928
Task: 42528

commit_message:
Limit qemu-img execution arenas

qemu-img attempts to launch multiple threads by default *and*
attempts to have multiple memory allocation arenas to operate
from. While multithreading can be good for performance, this
pattern and the memory footprint for process launch and
dependencies can turn the memory footprint for a cirros image
conversion (16MB) into 1.2GB of memory being asked for by the
qemu-img tool.

In order to limit this impact, as the default number of arenas
is governed by the number of CPUs times the number 8, it seems
reasonable to lower this to a more reasonable number which
also helps keep our possible memory footprint from being exceeded.

Change-Id: I71a28ec59ec31c691205eb34d9fcab63a2ccb682
Story: 2008928
Task: 42528

commit_message:
CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0
(cherry picked from commit 337771143ba7c392665a14e8aa2434817d9e9473)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 10:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: make cross cell resize spawn from snapshot image

During a cross cell resize, we do an instance snapshot and
then we spawn() instance back on target cell.

Unfortunately, we mistakenly spawn back the instance to its original
image id, instead of using freshly created snapshot_id.

The change proposes to update instance.image_ref with snapshot_id
in order that spawn()->_create_image() uses it and set back
instance.image_ref after.

Note that for qcow2 backend case, we also need to rebase disk image
with its original backing file to avoid mismatch between
instance.image_ref and backing file, as we currently do in unshelve
context.

Change-Id: I0b81282eba8238d8b64a67e38cf9d6392de1f85c
Closes-Bug: #1906428
(cherry picked from commit f02899418db9fa118a7bd0c813446b8dce51b7d7)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: make cross cell resize spawn from snapshot image

During a cross cell resize, we do an instance snapshot and
then we spawn() instance back on target cell.

Unfortunately, we mistakenly spawn back the instance to its original
image id, instead of using freshly created snapshot_id.

The change proposes to update instance.image_ref with snapshot_id
in order that spawn()->_create_image() uses it and set back
instance.image_ref after.

Note that for qcow2 backend case, we also need to rebase disk image
with its original backing file to avoid mismatch between
instance.image_ref and backing file, as we currently do in unshelve
context.

Change-Id: I0b81282eba8238d8b64a67e38cf9d6392de1f85c
Closes-Bug: #1906428
(cherry picked from commit f02899418db9fa118a7bd0c813446b8dce51b7d7)

commit_message:
Make _get_efi_bootloaders return relative paths

To make this function useful for purposes other than efibootmgr
entries, this change moves the path manipulation to _run_efibootmgr.

This change also adds boot*.efi entries to BOOTLOADERS_EFI so that it
includes every entry in the UEFI Spec 2.9[1] Table 3-2 UEFI Image
Types.

[1] https://uefi.org/sites/default/files/resources/UEFI_Spec_2_9_2021_03_18.pdf
Story: 2008923
Task: 42521

Change-Id: Ibe02786609aa0de65115897d8f4a9b4f36c8aed2

[{'created': '2021-05-27 10:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'image_meta: Provide image_ref as the id when fetching from instance

At present various users of instance.image_meta expect it to be a fully
populated ImageMeta object. However when the instance is pulled from the
database the ImageMeta object is only partially populated via
instance.system_metadata with a limited set of attributes such as
min_ram, min_disk, disk_format and container_format. This can result in
NotImplementedErrors being raised by o.vo as seen in bug #1928063 when
an attempt is made to access common attributes such as id or name.

To avoid this the id is now provided by instance.image_ref when
available.

The majority of the change is test fallout and ensuring that valid UUIDs
are provided as instance.image_ref and used by instance.image_meta.

(cherry picked from commit a2791fb5d2ae30d2861c2f04627eb48df01a30e7)
'}]
commit_message:
image_meta: Provide image_ref as the id when fetching from instance

At present various users of instance.image_meta expect it to be a fully
populated ImageMeta object. However when the instance is pulled from the
database the ImageMeta object is only partially populated via
instance.system_metadata with a limited set of attributes such as
min_ram, min_disk, disk_format and container_format. This can result in
NotImplementedErrors being raised by o.vo as seen in bug #1928063 when
an attempt is made to access common attributes such as id or name.

To avoid this the id is now provided by instance.image_ref when
available.

The majority of the change is test fallout and ensuring that valid UUIDs
are provided as instance.image_ref and used by instance.image_meta.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as Idc035671892e4668141a93763f8f2bed7a630812
is not present in stable/victoria.

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_machine_type_utils.py

Related-Bug: #1928063
Change-Id: I55d66c3a6cbd50da90065f4a58f77b5cd29ce9ea
(cherry picked from commit 9d037f7d199443da0f2c6c1755704e589d52e730)
(cherry picked from commit a2791fb5d2ae30d2861c2f04627eb48df01a30e7)

commit_message:
BnR added error msg in case there is no inventory

Currently both the undercloud backup and the overcloud backup
dont show any error msg when the inventory file does not exit.

This patch adds an error msg in case the inventory file does not exit

Change-Id: I57b43a550d8baf23add7794150e1f8591f756275
(cherry picked from commit f737dfcc025536c87c7b344f813150fad877f4e6)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Id0b52f70e02b08d4983a218af7c2e34c38ec3c7d

commit_message:
Remove warning about session with and without enginefacade

Now we moved all code to the new enginefacade so we don't need this
check anymore.
And BTW. I think it wasn't working properly as even if we are using new
facade we still see plenty of those warnings in e.g. logs of the
neutron functional tests CI job.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: Ib2933e4f52e8d7585c13a0d1a3485389fa37b432

subject: Use /dev/sdx instead of /dev/sdc when mounting boot images
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 13:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use /dev/sdx instead of /dev/sdc when mounting boot images

Currently when mounting cdrom device we are hardcoding use of /dev/sdc.
Given that in some scenarios users may want to attach additional disks
to their VMs, it means they need to be aware that using /dev/sdc is not
permitted if e.g. there is an inspector image mounted as Virtual Media.

In order to simplify the usage we are instead mounting boot devices as
/dev/sdx so that users have a freedom of creating block devices without
discontinuous names.

Change-Id: Ifd072ca6e0a88da138d9ef7140499faca1705c46
'}]
commit_message:
Use /dev/sdx instead of /dev/sdc when mounting boot images

Currently when mounting cdrom device we are hardcoding use of /dev/sdc.
Given that in some scenarios users may want to attach additional disks
to their VMs, it means they need to be aware that using /dev/sdc is not
permitted if e.g. there is an inspector image mounted as Virtual Media.

In order to simplify the usage we are instead mounting boot devices as
/dev/sdx so that users have a freedom of creating block devices without
discontinuous names.

Change-Id: Ifd072ca6e0a88da138d9ef7140499faca1705c46

Add support for the Neutron L3 conntrack helper API

Neutron has got CRUD API for L3 conntrack helper since some time.
This patch adds support for it in the SDK.

Related-Bug: #1823633

subject: Dropping lower constraints testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-03 01:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I6f54da507978d5fe59919e2008104d3667d59387
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I6f54da507978d5fe59919e2008104d3667d59387

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 10:06:01.000000000', 'message': 'Release oslo.cache for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for ososlo.cache for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch

commit_message:
Release oslo.cache for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for ososlo.cache for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.7.0..d89cc82
d89cc82 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
b1528f9 Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.
68917b1 Add Python3 xena unit tests
83a443f Update master for stable/wallaby
6f3c6c9 Adding technical details about the memcache pool backend.
e5d0b20 Add bug comment and fix nits
9606e85 Dropping lower constraints testing.
51d7b46 Drop use of deprecated collections classes
0cf7b0e Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I709018dc678544915458aa8cbad8582956d32958

commit_message:
[searchlight] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I67f7eb1647093cf9198ad053f1766ede3f3ec578

commit_message:
[qinling] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I2f92726d8a5b114045535fa820cbdee8cd5bfa9d

commit_message:
[karbor] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I0d276ca2d6259ebed2f646ef84750ae743f900bc

commit_message:
Disable selinux in CentOS7 beaker job

This change ensures selinux is disable on CentOS7 beaker job to
workaround an selinux denial currently blocking the gate.

Backport note:
This commit includes the following two commits which fixed some issues
with the task to disable selinux.

e7d7ba5c8fbfa388d6dcd8c92a07114a5824e575
Fix ansible error when making selinux permissive

ba73591f2208d03cb499c6f588e10b86e8327259
Update selinux mode by root

Related-Bug: #1927210
Change-Id: Ie1bf3ebdb2642e24beb10d80878b8eecd67ce9e0
(cherry picked from commit 952ae0e3f152ed55eeebe8f099a6e8c5c6da4553)

commit_message:
Fix for query ids without underscore

tox[1] fails if there there is a query id in queries.yml[2] which has space seperated characters/strings .
This fix adds a step, which joins the space separated strings in the query id with underscore
to the converter script[3].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci-health-queries/src/branch/master/playbooks/sova.yml#L54
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci-health-queries/src/branch/master/src/data/queries.yml
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci-health-queries/src/branch/master/src/sova-converter.py

Change-Id: I47ccb089c93b0a1cf944e91d819eed923fb62d8a

commit_message:
Release python-designateclient for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for ospython-designateclient for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.2.0..9bc517a
820f1e9 Remove six and update lower-constraints appdirs
f8353c5 Add Python3 xena unit tests
cafa8a3 Update master for stable/wallaby
0e32928 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
1f6f489 Remove install unnecessary packages
e3b88ed Fix lower-constrains job
8492a9e Update readme.rst
c0f62f2 bump py37 to py38 in tox.ini
196cb61 Fixed zone transfer accept list command
dd7fd96 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[monasca] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I4b843ca178d8dd0636854d0e6cadbf43896afeed

subject: Branch openstack-ansible projects
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-25 09:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-05-25 12:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Super bad time for us, as all roles are current;y not passing linters CI and we have https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22integrated_linters%22+(status:open) to track this. Also because of that we haven;t merged a lot of stuff that would be not super easy to backport.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-05-25 12:28:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was planning to suggest branching by this time, but ansible 4.0.0 release happened which broke some dependencies we're relying on...
I hope this will be sorted out during this week or maybe beginning of the next one"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-27 09:45:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I was planning to suggest branching by this time, but ansible 4.0.0 release happened which broke some dependencies we're relying on...
> I hope this will be sorted out during this week or maybe beginning of the next one

No problem, it was more a convenience patch.

The deadline for trailing projects is R-14.

I'll update our process to move this kind of check later after the deadline. Our goal was to avoid forgetting to cut trailing projects as did in the past with previous series.

Let's ignore and abandon this patch and try it later.

Thanks for your attention."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-27 09:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:

This patch propose to create a rc release for Wallaby and branch on the

Feel free to update the proposed SHA if you think that it's necessary.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/process.html#milestone-1

Change-Id: I748cef3ef0eea966cdfc61e10bca45573c1474e8
"}]
commit_message:
Branch openstack-ansible projects

We are near from the Xena's milestone-1, at this point [1] all the
trailing projects should be branched.

This patch propose to create a rc release for Wallaby and branch on the
top of it.

This patch also remove a couple of openstack-ansible-roles that have
been deprecated for awhile.

Feel free to update the proposed SHA if you think that it's necessary.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/process.html#milestone-1

Change-Id: I748cef3ef0eea966cdfc61e10bca45573c1474e8

messages: [{'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-05-25 16:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-05-25 16:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to memcached-cert'}, {'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-05-27 09:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoning in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/792131 backport'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 16:11:12.000000000', 'message': '[Train only] Allow setting IPs and DNS names in memcached cert

Currently memcached certificate is configured only with the FQDN.
Some memcached clients connect to the memcached service by supplying
a list of IP addresses. Certificate validation may fail if this is
the case.

Related-Bug: 1929574
Change-Id: I8e17902c14a8b4895358eed1043581e745335010
'}]
commit_message:
[Train only] Allow setting IPs and DNS names in memcached cert

Currently memcached certificate is configured only with the FQDN.
Some memcached clients connect to the memcached service by supplying
a list of IP addresses. Certificate validation may fail if this is
the case.

Related-Bug: 1929574
Change-Id: I8e17902c14a8b4895358eed1043581e745335010

commit_message:
[Train only] Add memcached IP address to its certificate

Some memcached clients connect to the memcached service by supplying
a list of IP addresses. Certificate validation may fail if this is
the case.

Closes-Bug: 1929574
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/793003
Change-Id: If7eb3d02fe960543cdd59372e000c06315518987

commit_message:
Drop Fedora support

Fedora support is never tested, and has been unmaintained for a while.
Because we don't expect any actual user using OpenStack on Fedora, this
change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I6cbb09bda0ee91c8a5d206697cef30b42f61aef5

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Constraints on jinja2 relaxed.

python-tripleoclient removed

Closes-Bug: #1929420

'}]
commit_message:
Release ironic-lib for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for osironic-lib for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.6.1..36b8486
36b8486 convert_image: add flags required for IPA
df9a2e8 Raise qemu-img memory limit to 2 GiB
37ac433 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
9fb5be3 Stop testing the iscsi deploy interface
4cf1b4f Remove runtime dependency on pbr
fb8b6c1 Add Python3 xena unit tests

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic9099ec98cb08374a6abcdd06f0374eb126716a6

subject: Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-26 18:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-05-27 07:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 18:05:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

Story: 2008881
Task: 42426
Related: rhbz#1954096
Change-Id: Ie3bd49add9a57fabbcdcbae4b73309066b620d02
(cherry picked from commit fe825fa97ed1f3c9fa8b1461b63ab133fec20b72)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

Story: 2008881
Task: 42426
Related: rhbz#1954096
Change-Id: Ie3bd49add9a57fabbcdcbae4b73309066b620d02
(cherry picked from commit fe825fa97ed1f3c9fa8b1461b63ab133fec20b72)

commit_message:
QoS minimum guaranteed packet rate

Similarly to how bandwidth can be a limiting factor of a network
interface, packet processing capacity tend to be a limiting factor of
the soft switching solutions like OVS. In the same time certain
applications are dependent on not just guaranteed bandwidth but also
on guaranteed packet rate to function properly. OpenStack already
supports bandwidth guarantees via the minimum bandwidth QoS policy
rules. This specification is aiming for adding support for a similar
minimum packet rate QoS policy rule.

blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate
Change-Id: I91ebf31daf4c36d980e93bd806a08b83e80f17b1

commit_message:
CI: Debian Bullseye kernel cmdline change and reboot

Debian Bullseye comes with cgroups v2 enabled by default
(so no cgroups v1). Libvirt (without systemd) has an
issue supporting those - so a workaround is needed to
enable cgroups v1 in kernel cmdline (and reboot the node).

Change-Id: I48f834916217a2239d7b8da64117c7c92dd53f32

commit_message:
Rename local variable component to validation_component for Upstream CI

The usage of the component variable for the local and check jobs is
dangerous since this variable is used by the whole component chain for TripleO.
This review renamed it to validation_component.

Change-Id: Icd8e64282306479a84fc6240142ddcb28ce433e5

[{'created': '2021-05-21 16:32:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ephemeral Heat: Add a --refresh option to external update run

In order to support ephemeral Heat, the external update run command
should rely on the already downloaded config-download playbooks as
generated by update prepare. There is no Heat instance available to
re-download the playbooks automatically.

To support the old behavior with a system installed Heat, a --refresh
option is added which will refresh the config-download playbooks.

We can not have an option to refresh the playbooks automatically with
ephemeral Heat, because the command would need to inherit from
DeployCommand and require environment files so that we can use the
ContainerImagePrepare value to get the ephemeral Heat container images,
as well as the ephemeral Heat setup and tear down code. As this would be
a much larger refactor to the CLI, we avoid it.

The correct fix for the case where the stack may have been modified out
of order is to require another run of update prepare which will
regenerate the playbooks.

Change-Id: Ib01d920112f5e84190fbcd9470dd7bac269b3987
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

ContainerImagePrepare value to get the ephemeral Heat container images,
as well as the ephemeral Heat setup and tear down code. As this would be
a much larger refactor to the CLI, we avoid it.

The correct fix for the case where the stack may have been modified out
of order is to require another run of update prepare which will

Change-Id: Ib01d920112f5e84190fbcd9470dd7bac269b3987
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ephemeral Heat: Add a --refresh option to external update run

In order to support ephemeral Heat, the external update run command
should rely on the already downloaded config-download playbooks as
generated by update prepare. There is no Heat instance available to
re-download the playbooks automatically.

To support the old behavior with a system installed Heat, a --refresh
option is added which will refresh the config-download playbooks.

We can not have an option to refresh the playbooks automatically with
ephemeral Heat, because the command would need to inherit from
DeployCommand and require environment files so that we can use the
ContainerImagePrepare value to get the ephemeral Heat container images,
as well as the ephemeral Heat setup and tear down code. As this would be
a much larger refactor to the CLI, we avoid it.

The correct fix for the case where the stack may have been modified out
of order is to require another run of update prepare which will
regenerate the playbooks.

Change-Id: Ib01d920112f5e84190fbcd9470dd7bac269b3987
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-14 22:33:34.000000000', 'message': "Ephemeral Heat unit tests

This patch adds unit tests for the ephemeral Heat feature.

Additionally, the following changes are combined into this commit:
- Adds compression for ephemeral Heat db and log file backups
- Configures a specific log_file in the generated heat.conf so we can
  have a unique log file per execution so as not to overwrite previous
  log files. Provides better debuggability as each exeuction is in it's
  own log file.
- Guards the mount/umount of tmpfs for the heat dir with use_root, so as
  to supress the warnings about the commands failing when not using
  root.
- Configures the logger in tripleo_launch_heat.py as just 'tripleoclient'
  so that the configuration propagates to other loggers that inherit
  from 'tripleoclient'
- Fixes tripleo_launch_heat.py to only attempt to kill heat once when
  --kill is passed.
- Minor fixes uncovered during the unit test addition.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I44f8d8a208f1b38ccfdd2b4b225c877e539e57cd
"}, {'created': '2021-05-15 00:10:16.000000000', 'message': "Ephemeral Heat unit tests

This patch adds unit tests for the ephemeral Heat feature.

Additionally, the following changes are combined into this commit:
- Adds compression for ephemeral Heat db and log file backups
- Configures a specific log_file in the generated heat.conf so we can
  have a unique log file per execution so as not to overwrite previous

commit_message:
Ephemeral Heat unit tests

This patch adds unit tests for the ephemeral Heat feature.

Additionally, the following changes are combined into this commit:
- Adds compression for ephemeral Heat db and log file backups
- Configures a specific log_file in the generated heat.conf so we can
  have a unique log file per execution so as not to overwrite previous
  log files. Provides better debuggability as each exeuction is in it's
  own log file.
- Guards the mount/umount of tmpfs for the heat dir with use_root, so as
  to supress the warnings about the commands failing when not using
  root.
- Configures the logger in tripleo_launch_heat.py as just 'tripleoclient'
  so that the configuration propagates to other loggers that inherit
  from 'tripleoclient'
- Fixes tripleo_launch_heat.py to only attempt to kill heat once when
  --kill is passed.
- Minor fixes uncovered during the unit test addition.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I44f8d8a208f1b38ccfdd2b4b225c877e539e57cd

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

Change-Id: Ifd34735a20342370e4c02110d023342d11a0dbfe
(cherry picked from commit cec0b1af7c0dccdb17f2ecb7f7913f2e384b0b20)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 17:06:06.000000000', 'message': "Breakdown the deploy-steps playbook

This change breaks the deploy-steps monster playbook into isolated playbook
files allowing us to use the deploy-steps entrypoint as a playbook router.

With this change we'll be able to further optimise our playbook processes
in isolation and begin exploring different methods of deployment for parts
of our stack. Additionally this change will make it possible for advanced
users to run playbooks as needed, without having to run everything from
top to bottom.

Change-Id: I34bb41e63ccc65ae47999758ab7ce8a6120ef0a4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Breakdown the deploy-steps playbook

This change breaks the deploy-steps monster playbook into isolated playbook
files allowing us to use the deploy-steps entrypoint as a playbook router.

With this change we'll be able to further optimise our playbook processes
in isolation and begin exploring different methods of deployment for parts
of our stack. Additionally this change will make it possible for advanced
users to run playbooks as needed, without having to run everything from
top to bottom.

Change-Id: I34bb41e63ccc65ae47999758ab7ce8a6120ef0a4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-21 18:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 31241, 'date': '2021-05-22 20:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-27 00:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-27 03:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-21 18:42:08.000000000', 'message': 'tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
(cherry picked from commit 77530136f13f1fc0d8625d43e1689427d4ee2fad)
'}]
commit_message:
tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
(cherry picked from commit 77530136f13f1fc0d8625d43e1689427d4ee2fad)

subject: POC: add reseller_admin info endpoint to grab error_limited info
messages: [{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-27 05:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 05:33:41.000000000', 'message': "POC: add reseller_admin info endpoint to grab error_limited info

Currently there isn't an easy way to see the current state of what the
proxies have in their error_limiting dict in memory.

This patch allows you to get a json dump of it by hitting the
`/info/error_limited` endpoint. But this endpoint is only available if
you are a reseller admin.

It's kinda like a recon, and maybe I should just make a proxy recon
endpoint in a controller and rename it to /recon/error_limited, but I
wanted to get something to see if it worked first.

Change-Id: I51390aacc4b73a957556b8b7a5b50a11b2f19f2b
"}]
commit_message:
POC: add reseller_admin info endpoint to grab error_limited info

Currently there isn't an easy way to see the current state of what the
proxies have in their error_limiting dict in memory.

This patch allows you to get a json dump of it by hitting the
`/info/error_limited` endpoint. But this endpoint is only available if
you are a reseller admin.

It's kinda like a recon, and maybe I should just make a proxy recon
endpoint in a controller and rename it to /recon/error_limited, but I
wanted to get something to see if it worked first.

Change-Id: I51390aacc4b73a957556b8b7a5b50a11b2f19f2b

subject: [WIP] Don't grub2-install overwrite EFI bootloaders
messages:
[{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-26 01:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-26 02:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-26 05:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-26 13:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-27 02:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I just deployed a partition image overcloud-full using master IPA, and it looks like the _preserve_efi_assets path leads to a successful deployment because grub2-install is not run.

Given the changed grub2-install behaviour will only occur on new images I think it is acceptable to require that they come with a populated /boot/efi as well. This leaves the whole-disk+softraid scenario which is the only one that always calls grub2-install. Its not clear to me why softraid doesn't use _preserve_efi_assets. I'm hoping its because of an abundance of caution, and it may just work if we switch over. See https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/src/branch/master/ironic_python_agent/extensions/image.py#L579"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-05-27 06:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is some history to it. At the time, we squeezed the UEFI RAID in just before Train (?), all was tested with grub. At around the same time the move to efibootmgr was made, but we considered to switch wdi+raid to be too risky. Ofc, we said we would fix this later :-D

Also, preserve_efi_assets did not exist at the time.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 01:14:37.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Don't grub2-install overwrite EFI bootloaders

Grub 2.04 no longer supports direct invocation of grub2-install when
the machine is in UEFI mode as it does not support secure-boot.

This change avoids calling grub2-install when there is already an EFI
bootloader in the expected location (such as
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI).

This change also changes _configure_grub to walk /boot/efi directories
looking for other grub.cfg files to overwrite with the generated
grub.cfg. For example on centos, the generated /boot/grub2/grub.cfg will be
copied to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grub.cfg.

This is consistent with recent changes in diskimage-builder to support
installing the shim bootloader and signed grub.

WIP, some of the ~19 _install_grub2 unit tests needs to exercise
skipping the grub2-install and copying grub.cfg to signed grub
directories.

Story: 2008923
Task: 42521
Change-Id: Ieaa60ccccabec8aa300184e2f2666c11990d74d3
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Don't grub2-install overwrite EFI bootloaders

Grub 2.04 no longer supports direct invocation of grub2-install when
the machine is in UEFI mode as it does not support secure-boot.

This change avoids calling grub2-install when there is already an EFI
bootloader in the expected location (such as
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI).

This change also changes _configure_grub to walk /boot/efi directories
looking for other grub.cfg files to overwrite with the generated
grub.cfg. For example on centos, the generated /boot/grub2/grub.cfg will be
copied to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grub.cfg.

This is consistent with recent changes in diskimage-builder to support
installing the shim bootloader and signed grub.

WIP, some of the ~19 _install_grub2 unit tests needs to exercise
skipping the grub2-install and copying grub.cfg to signed grub
directories.

Story: 2008923
Task: 42521
Change-Id: Ieaa60ccccabec8aa300184e2f2666c11990d74d3

commit_message:
Switch neutron-tempest-plugin-api job to be ML2/OVS

It will give us more API tests coverage as we don't need to e.g.
skip logging tests, even when Devstack will be switched to the ML2/OVN
backend.
It also enables deploying Neutron with uwsgi again, as with ML2/OVS
backend it isn't broken.

Change-Id: I90f3c430504677a42e98230b84ea87f863c1331b
Closes: #1928345

commit_message:
Ussuri-only: Fix duplicated declaration of nova::cache parameters

Currently there are two places where nova::cache parameters are defined
and the latter definitions based on EnableCache is not working as
expected. This change fixes that conflict.

The top definition of nova::cache parameter was introduced during
Ussuri cycle and this was fixed in Victoria by [1], so this change
is submitted only to Ussuri.

[1] f3ac958f47cae8f99e45ea3edefa099c1711789c

Change-Id: I8e0a94f4fc6e7bee9c7fb5cd9d4a28016d5868d6

Forward returncode from sync program

messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-26 20:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-05-26 22:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-27 00:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+1'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-27 02:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nlgtm'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 20:47:31.000000000', 'message': 'Limit the number of malloc arenas for qemu-img convert

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed
in this mannor should the.

Since this is only something which should realistically occur under
heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors
and VMs inside those hypervisors), then a new arena gets created, and
the memory consumption spikes.

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

Change-Id: I8b2b490f2cc0ac5f47c3aaaaa249ce59db6602d6
Story: 2008928
Task: 42529
'}]
commit_message:
Limit the number of malloc arenas for qemu-img convert

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed
in this mannor should the.

Since this is only something which should realistically occur under
heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors
and VMs inside those hypervisors), then a new arena gets created, and
the memory consumption spikes.

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

Change-Id: I8b2b490f2cc0ac5f47c3aaaaa249ce59db6602d6
Story: 2008928
Task: 42529

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 12:00:06.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icc9b9a3af1c8cf58b3a2b9626065cb2fcd074a42
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icc9b9a3af1c8cf58b3a2b9626065cb2fcd074a42

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-21 08:23:46.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

(cherry picked from Neutron ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8604bc54f727ff9f194575d2dffc041246677c1a
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

(cherry picked from Neutron ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8604bc54f727ff9f194575d2dffc041246677c1a

commit_message:
Explicitely set nodeset to Bionic-based

The default nodeset has been updated to Ubuntu Focal in [1]. Train CI
jobs need to be explicitely set to Bionic-based nodeset or else Devstack
will fail to deploy with the following message:

  "WARNING: this script has not been tested on focal"

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/788954

Change-Id: I1281e74a398d03eac8db7a468e71ea4889dd8229

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib041764adc8e0a22522be254581d3debb7fe8bb2

commit_message:
Set python versions for rhel > 8

EL8 was shipped with python 3.6, EL9 is being shipped with
python 3.9, so let's set python versions accordingly.

Change-Id: I5d857a3fbab2143c490016cd6b9cfc78ecb382e5

commit_message:
Fix lint error with the latest lint packages

This change fixes the following lint error which is detected since we
removed pin of lint packages.

manifests/init.pp:34:WARNING: class included by absolute name
(::$class)

Change-Id: Ibce175a4bdfa2608c435611d80ae1ce7b410f93c

commit_message:
Add neutron port tag hint for role name

Adds a tag tripleo_role=$ROLE to neutron ports
created by heat.

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I238572444e2931546d44864b2de497dd2825c2dc
(cherry picked from commit 659cc552772241ba95cbd7ea809040606f162b13)

commit_message:
Prepare the final stable/train release

The stable/train is entering in extended manitenance. Because we have
seveal changes merged since the last release, a new release should be
created before that.

I will leave it to those in the know to see if this patch is necessary."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-21 14:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-21 14:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> spelling nit.  
> I had a look at the stable/train code base and it look like 'import mock' is used everywhere.
> I will leave it to those in the know to see if this patch is necessary.

mock is part of the test-requirements but not the requirements. 

    $ grep -R "import mock" | grep -v "tests"
    cinder/volume/drivers/infinidat.py:from unittest import mock
    cinder/test.py:import mock

infinidat is the only file using mock in their production code.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2021-05-21 15:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

This should be safe to just manually fix in Train.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-05-21 15:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

In fact https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/700253 can't be really backported to train, as it was done under the assumption of using python3 only. It would need to be redone, but train is in Extended Maintenance state, so definitely no go.
Even if no new releases are cut from train, the fix is still useful.

It poses a bigger question though: why is mock needed in production (non testing) code? If the "driver API" provided by cinder core is not enough, maybe it would be worth discussing about it.

So +1 for the change itself, but maybe something need to be changed.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-05-21 15:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

In fact you already created https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1928232 (thanks Sofia for noticing). We probably need to involve Infinidat people.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2021-05-21 15:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> In fact https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/700253 can't be really backported to train, as it was done under the assumption of using python3 only. It would need to be redone, but train is in Extended Maintenance state, so definitely no go.
> Even if no new releases are cut from train, the fix is still useful.
> 
> It poses a bigger question though: why is mock needed in production (non testing) code? If the "driver API" provided by cinder core is not enough, maybe it would be worth discussing about it.

It's being use above in L623
> 
> So +1 for the change itself, but maybe something need to be changed.

I'm not completely sure about this fix so I'll wait for core reviewers opinions. However, I think the best idea it's to fix the mock problem in master an then backport it back to train.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-05-21 15:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> > In fact https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/700253 can't be really backported to train, as it was done under the assumption of using python3 only. It would need to be redone, but train is in Extended Maintenance state, so definitely no go.
> > Even if no new releases are cut from train, the fix is still useful.
> > 
> > It poses a bigger question though: why is mock needed in production (non testing) code? If the "driver API" provided by cinder core is not enough, maybe it would be worth discussing about it.
> 
> It's being use above in L623
> > 
> > So +1 for the change itself, but maybe something need to be changed.
> 
> I'm not completely sure about this fix so I'll wait for core reviewers opinions. However, I think the best idea it's to fix the mock problem in master an then backport it back to train.

While I general agree, the change may be disruptive enough to be backported to a branch in EM state.

So this is still a valid workaround, which doesn't make things worse than how they are now.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-21 16:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> > > 
> > > So +1 for the change itself, but maybe something need to be changed.

I'm no infinidat driver expert here, I don't have access to their product. I opened a LP for them to work on, but I didn't want to venture this path.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

Putting a -2 on this until we sort it out.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-25 17:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Putting a -2 on this until we sort it out.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-26 16:57:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Quick summary of what was said at today's Cinder meeting:
- Ideally we'd fix this by removing mock completely and the active LP will document this work.
- There's no Infinidat CI running at this time so it's hard to cleanly fix this without being able to validate.
- This patch will not make it worse for py2 cases but will fix py3 cases.
- py2 users are expected to have mock installed in production anyways and this will fallback on it.
- Modifying setup.cfg to add a dependency to mock is a bit more intrusive than just testing for unittest.mock."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-26 21:36:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

David's summary of what we discussed at today's cinder meeting is accurate, so lifting my -2 and approving this patch."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-12 12:52:21.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Fix mock import for infinidat driver

Infinidat wrongfully imports mock but it should be imported from
unitted. This was fixed during the Ussuri cycle via the mammoth commit
[1].

I'm not sure we want to backport this whole commit down to train but we
certainly want to fix this bug.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/700253

Change-Id: I6f5443417b7b07c648b81fddcda430496078573c
"}, {'created': '2021-05-17 02:10:18.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Fix mock import for infinidat driver

Infinidat wrongfully imports mock but it should be imported from
unitted. This was fixed during the Ussuri cycle via the mammoth commit
[1].

I'm not sure we want to backport this whole commit down to train but we

commit_message:
[train-only] Fix mock import for infinidat driver

Infinidat wrongfully imports mock but it should be imported from
unittest. This was fixed during the Ussuri cycle via the mammoth commit
[1].

I'm not sure we want to backport this whole commit down to train but we
certainly want to fix this bug.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/700253

Change-Id: I6f5443417b7b07c648b81fddcda430496078573c

[{'created': '2021-05-25 19:51:29.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-rgw] Add placement target delete support to RGW

A new "delete" value has been added to the ceph-rgw placement
target spec to allow existing placement targets to be deleted in a
brownfield deployment. For deployments where a deleted placement
target does not exist, the placement target will be created and
deleted in a single step.

commit_message:
[ceph-rgw] Add placement target delete support to RGW

A new "delete" value has been added to the ceph-rgw placement
target spec to allow existing placement targets to be deleted in a
brownfield deployment. For deployments where a deleted placement
target does not exist, the placement target will be created and
deleted in a single step.

Change-Id: I34e6d97543b63848b267332556b62d50d1865f49

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-26 18:04:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

Change-Id: Ie3bd49add9a57fabbcdcbae4b73309066b620d02

commit_message:
Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

Story: 2008881
Task: 42426
Related: rhbz#1954096
Change-Id: Ie3bd49add9a57fabbcdcbae4b73309066b620d02
(cherry picked from commit fe825fa97ed1f3c9fa8b1461b63ab133fec20b72)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 18:13:33.000000000', 'message': "Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae
"}]
commit_message:
Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

commit_message:
Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

commit_message:
Fix NVMe Partition image on UEFI

The _manage_uefi code has a check where it attempts to just
identify the precise partition number of the device, in order
for configuration to be parsed and passed. However, the same code
did not handle the existence of a `p1` partition instead of just a
partition #1. This is because the device naming format is different
with NVMe and Software RAID.

Likely, this wasn't an issue with software raid due to how complex the
code interaction is, but the docs also indicate to use only whole disk
images in that case.

This patch was pulled down my one RH's professional services folks
who has confirmed it does indeed fix the issue at hand. This is noted
as a public comment on the Red Hat bugzilla.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954096

commit_message:
Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
