commit_message:
tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
(cherry picked from commit 77530136f13f1fc0d8625d43e1689427d4ee2fad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-18 17:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Stop testing volume v2 APIs

Cinder decided to remove the v2 APIs[1] in Xena cycle, so
in Tempest we need to modify the tempest-cinder-v2-api job
to run against stable wallaby which is last release where
volume v2 APIs are present.

Also ad deprecation warning at v2 service clients module level
import so that we can remove them once Tempest stop supporting
stable wallaby.

NOTE: we do not need to adjust any tests as we already moved all
the Tempest tests to volume v3 APIs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791842

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderXenaPTGSummary#Removing_the_Block_Storage_API_v2

Change-Id: I98339f67239cf96d26aa4fa87df692139b36673d
'}, {'created': '2021-05-18 20:02:58.000000000', 'message': 'Stop testing volume v2 APIs

Cinder decided to remove the v2 APIs[1] in Xena cycle, so
in Tempest we need to modify the tempest-cinder-v2-api job
to run against stable wallaby which is last release where
volume v2 APIs are present.

Also ad deprecation warning at v2 service clients module level
import so that we can remove them once Tempest stop supporting
stable wallaby.

NOTE: we do not need to adjust any tests as we already moved all
the Tempest tests to volume v3 APIs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791842

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderXenaPTGSummary#Removing_the_Block_Storage_API_v2

Change-Id: I98339f67239cf96d26aa4fa87df692139b36673d
'}]
commit_message:
Stop testing volume v2 APIs

Cinder decided to remove the v2 APIs[1] in Xena cycle, so
in Tempest we need to modify the tempest-cinder-v2-api job
to run against stable wallaby which is last release where
volume v2 APIs are present.

Also ad deprecation warning at v2 service clients module level
import so that we can remove them once Tempest stop supporting
stable wallaby.

NOTE: we do not need to adjust any tests as we already moved all
the Tempest tests to volume v3 APIs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791842

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderXenaPTGSummary#Removing_the_Block_Storage_API_v2

Change-Id: I98339f67239cf96d26aa4fa87df692139b36673d

commit_message:
Skip cephadm playbook when there is no mon or nfs group

This change just make us able to skip the cephadm playbook when no
mons or nfs nodes are defined by the inventory.

Change-Id: I1717185ac2394d400e0617ab9aca45088160bcd2

messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-24 18:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-26 12:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-26 15:16:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I've proposed another patch [1], that is more like fixing the existing lower constraints than removing most of them.
I'm in favor of keeping the lower constraints as it makes the lower-constraints job less vulnerable to dependency changes in the future.
Also, in general, the l-c job is faster if there are more precise constraints. However it seems there are not so much difference as I saw in the first test run of this patch (10 mins vs 4 mins of py36/py38 unit test jobs, and now I see it ran in 5 mins).

Anyway, this patch also solves the issue and should unblock the gate, so I'm okay with this. (The job failures seem to be not connected to this patch)

[1] I3dee1cd2afd652e7748f7ba1c337c022ce50dfa7"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-05-26 15:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-05-26 18:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Looks correctly backported to stable/victoria from Wallaby where the change originally landed with conflicts correctly resolved. Looks OK to me'}]

lower-constraints file manually didn't work out, so start specifying
only the direct dependencies here, relying on upper-constraints for the
given release to restrict everything else.

Two dependencies, python-subunit and testrepository, are removed as
these are no longer necessary. Another, hacking, is moved to 'tox.ini'
since we're not managing this via the u-c system and don't need this
here.

Conflicts:
  test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I4bdc0d422813ecee1566256ec237d34f200406ee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 44d8937148aac1a61f40e59d3271c45f9fe6aa03)
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve dependency issues

This is totally broken with the pip 20.3 resolver. Attempts to fix the
lower-constraints file manually didn't work out, so start specifying
only the direct dependencies here, relying on upper-constraints for the
given release to restrict everything else.

Two dependencies, python-subunit and testrepository, are removed as
these are no longer necessary. Another, hacking, is moved to 'tox.ini'
since we're not managing this via the u-c system and don't need this
here.

Conflicts:
  test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I4bdc0d422813ecee1566256ec237d34f200406ee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 44d8937148aac1a61f40e59d3271c45f9fe6aa03)

[{'created': '2021-05-10 15:09:27.000000000', 'message': "Delay rendering configdrive

When the configdrive input is JSON (meta_data, etc), delay the rendering
until the ISO image is actually used. It has two benefits:
1) Avoid storing a large ISO image in instance_info,
2) Allow deploy steps to access the original user's input.

Change-Id: I86d30bbb505b8c794bfa6412606f4516f8885aa9
"}, {'created': '2021-05-10 17:56:55.000000000', 'message': "Delay rendering configdrive

When the configdrive input is JSON (meta_data, etc), delay the rendering
until the ISO image is actually used. It has two benefits:
1) Avoid storing a large ISO image in instance_info,
2) Allow deploy steps to access the original user's input.

Fix configdrive masking to correctly mask dicts.

Story: #2008875

commit_message:
Delay rendering configdrive

When the configdrive input is JSON (meta_data, etc), delay the rendering
until the ISO image is actually used. It has two benefits:
1) Avoid storing a large ISO image in instance_info,
2) Allow deploy steps to access the original user's input.

Fix configdrive masking to correctly mask dicts.

Story: #2008875
Task: #42419
Change-Id: I86d30bbb505b8c794bfa6412606f4516f8885aa9

commit_message:
libvirt: pin edk2-ovmf

edk2-ovmf introduced a bug [1] and results libvirt/qemu errors
It's going to be fixed in next rebase to libvirt 7.4.0 - but let's pin for now.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1961558#c10

Change-Id: I0cb0512ef40c48353d582b1c37a446f251b79ac7
(cherry picked from commit 1a2c33512b6c4bdcdbf7d7bb08e791fb53e4f063)

commit_message:
Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

commit_message:
Allow to send extra attributes in Neutron related commands

To deprecate and drop support for neutronclient CLI and use only
OSC we need feature parity between OSC and neutronclient.
Last missing piece here is possibility to send in POST/PUT requests
unknown parameters to the Neutron server.
This patch adds such possibility to the OSC.

Change-Id: Iba09297c2be9fb9fa0be1b3dc65755277b79230e

commit_message:
[CI] Add no-tls-proxy job

Some gates run devstack like this and it follows different code
paths.
Let's ensure we don't break it now and then.

Change-Id: I6ee1bfc30bced53f6d7fb841e01714069919fd88
Reference: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-July/015997.html

in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: Make vmcoreinfo checks guest arch specific

Previously, we were determining whether to enable the vmcoreinfo feature
based on support on the host architecture. In a world where we support
guest architectures that are different to the host architectures, this
will not suffice. Close this gap.

WIP because this requires a whole heap of improvements to the
fakelibvirt fixture to allow us to e.g. override the results on
'getDomainCapabilities' on a per-test basis.

Change-Id: Ic57616d3facfa116aea8dfbced8934505b0ae72a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix lower-constraints

With the new pip resolver lower-constraints job fails due to
contradicting requirements. This patch eliminates all those
contradictions and adds extra constraints to lower-constraints
to make the package dependency resolving faster.

Change-Id: I3dee1cd2afd652e7748f7ba1c337c022ce50dfa7

commit_message:
Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

[{'created': '2021-05-12 10:29:30.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Remove 'create_fake_libvirt_mock'

This is no longer necessary, as our fakelibvirt fixture is sufficiently
well developed to handle virtually all use cases required by these
tests. The sole exceptions are tests that do tests on instances before
"creating" the instance. Calls to 'lookupByUUIDString' inside these
tests fail since the fakelibvirt fixture has no record of the fake
instance, so we resolve this by simply mocking out that helper.

Change-Id: I2d7f814f811139a65546ba2360a40d216e7adf12
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

tests fail since the fakelibvirt fixture has no record of the fake

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Remove 'create_fake_libvirt_mock'

This is no longer necessary, as our fakelibvirt fixture is sufficiently
well developed to handle virtually all use cases required by these
tests. The sole exceptions are tests that do tests on instances before
"creating" the instance. Calls to 'lookupByUUIDString' inside these
tests fail since the fakelibvirt fixture has no record of the fake
instance, so we resolve this by simply mocking out that helper.

Change-Id: I2d7f814f811139a65546ba2360a40d216e7adf12
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 31828, 'date': '2021-05-13 12:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-21 13:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-05-26 16:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 12:29:07.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I6e015bf3955e3ff7aa21bc86d3f6f69e0017ca29
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I6e015bf3955e3ff7aa21bc86d3f6f69e0017ca29

commit_message:
libvirt: Make vmcoreinfo dependent on feature flag

Libvirt exposes a 'vmcoreinfo' feature flag that we can examine, rather
than hardcoding the feature's availability. Use it. Note that this
particular implementation still isn't great since it relies on us
checking things against the host architecture rather than the guest
architecture. Doing the latter requires a lot of test churn and isn't
necessary right now since we don't support guest architectures that are
different from the host.

Change-Id: Id0af5670c52733f9936a85f8efc6d832082cfa3a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate the fnmatch module.

Oslo.utils's fnmatch module was added to fix the py2.7 fnmatch module
who was not thread safe [1]. Python 2.7 is no longer supported so now we
can use the stdlib's fnmatch module and deprecate the one of oslo.utils.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue23191$
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/e46a46ba90741987f1147afc56876e3d0d27e8a2

Change-Id: I538379f91d2ba415c566ada8d221b62b47ba80bb

commit_message:
Don't spam retries 100s of times a second

We can get a TRY_AGAIN because the DB is down or because the
a command is doing an update that will never pass the verify()
condition. If this happens, we shouldn't send 100s of requests per
second until we eventually time out or things come back up, so add
a simple exponential backoff with reasonable max retry sleep of 8s.

Closes-Bug: #1907836
Change-Id: Ib757f182a4c7fdf25ed9374963ac5210e4d35523
(cherry picked form commit 6596164f51217cc7fabf302ce14ccc9d9beaff1f)

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I394e12bf1816e4e23e4f547db4bae89547af7989

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-25 03:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ib7db2f9aafa9b9a3acfb74ed33aef6c3355b4db8
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ib7db2f9aafa9b9a3acfb74ed33aef6c3355b4db8

[{'created': '2021-05-24 23:58:10.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: proxy-logging: measure time spent waiting on bytes from the backend

Clients can do crazy things and cause transfers to take arbitrarily long
amounts of time -- but the backend ought still be pretty snappy.

Change-Id: I5f3b42283eac3e3938ffee094ab9a23953ca5389
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: proxy-logging: measure time spent waiting on bytes from the backend

Clients can do crazy things and cause transfers to take arbitrarily long
amounts of time -- but the backend ought still be pretty snappy.

Change-Id: I5f3b42283eac3e3938ffee094ab9a23953ca5389

commit_message:
Update project conundrum related docs

Yes, project conundrum is a code-name for our transition to OFTC
as we do not want to put anything into freenode IRC which may abruptly
result in the channel being siezed or shutdown by the new
owners/operators of freenode

Change-Id: I45c07e0b2138f6643f865d58155c64317114fd02
See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022718.html

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I4f58234e6f2d0b0b8548d1cf53c266c562b411eb

commit_message:
Restore the spec file which was deleted unexpectedly

The commit 76a80d9e6c03290bc7445fb1bb2d03f0552a0434 removed one spec
file unexpectedly. This change reverts that deletion so that we have
proper unit test coverage.

Change-Id: I515022f78ddd49bfa626abe6586e1b03c036f525

[{'created': '2021-05-04 09:03:42.000000000', 'message': 'Update Neutron's Liuetenants

This patch updates list of the Neutron's stadium's projects lieutenants
and the list of the bugs' contact persons.

In details this patch:
- sets Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez as contact person for db and qos
  related issues,
- adds Oleg Bondarev as "loadimpact" bugs,
- removes Matt Riedemann as contact person for "logging" bugs,
- sets PTL/Drivers team as conctact for "troubleshooting" related bugs,

It also sets Lajos Katona as "Testing" lieutenant.

Finally it removes networking-ovn and neutron-fwaas from the list of
stadium projects and removes tag "fwaas" from the list of bug tags.
Neutron-fwaas was deprecated and isn't part of the stadium since long
time and networking-ovn is now one of the Neutron in-tree drivers.

Change-Id: Id4b928e077ed684c67d4b5054f12653d63f70788
'}]
commit_message:
Update Neutron's Liuetenants

This patch updates list of the Neutron's stadium's projects lieutenants
and the list of the bugs' contact persons.

In details this patch:
- sets Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez as contact person for db and qos
  related issues,
- adds Oleg Bondarev as "loadimpact" bugs,
- removes Matt Riedemann as contact person for "logging" bugs,
- sets PTL/Drivers team as conctact for "troubleshooting" related bugs,

It also sets Lajos Katona as "Testing" lieutenant.

Finally it removes networking-ovn and neutron-fwaas from the list of
stadium projects and removes tag "fwaas" from the list of bug tags.
Neutron-fwaas was deprecated and isn't part of the stadium since long
time and networking-ovn is now one of the Neutron in-tree drivers.

Change-Id: Id4b928e077ed684c67d4b5054f12653d63f70788

commit_message:
Create allocation if hostname matches display_name

To facilitate migration from nova to nova-less
deployment create an allocation when the display_name
in the ironic nodes instance_info matches the instance
name associated with the baremetal node matches the
hostname provided in the baremtal deployment YAML
definition.

Also add a safeguard to not allow creating allocations
with duplicate names.

Closes-Bug: #1928487
Change-Id: I743201875381e41b41c15569e0b41045651ac9e0

This patch relaxes the Jinja2 constraint since they recently released

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:44:48.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Id0c81ac91849d1d8dc661df73fe96d16d28b783a
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Id0c81ac91849d1d8dc661df73fe96d16d28b783a

commit_message:
Repropose flavour and image defined ephemeral storage encryption

This missed Wallaby due to unforeseen technical debt in the libvirt
implementation, reproposing the initial high level UX and scheduling
spec ahead of rewriting the libvirt implementation spec shortly.

Change-Id: Ib3fdda81c1a4dc1406d4245329dab0331e14aba0

subject: Pin nodeset for unit test job
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-05-25 18:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-05-25 18:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-25 18:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This looks sane, as pinning nodeset in advance can avoid issues in the future. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-05-25 20:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

makes sense, lgtm'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-05-26 10:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

good thinking'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 18:09:36.000000000', 'message': "Pin ndeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset deifned in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switch default nodeset to
latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on working distro version.

commit_message:
Pin nodeset for unit test job

devstack unit test job does not set any nodeset
and so does use default nodeset defined in base jobs
in opendev. When opendev switches the default nodeset to
the latest distro version, devstack unit test job can start
failing. Example:

- https://review.opendev.org/q/I01408f2f2959b0788fe712ac268a526502226ee9
- https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

To avoid such a situation in future, let's set the working nodeset
for this job also so that when we cut the stable branch we can
run it on the working distro version. 

Change-Id: I302140778fedf08bc8ba72c453837fa7b8f8f9ae

commit_message:
Don't spam retries 100s of times a second

We can get a TRY_AGAIN because the DB is down or because the
a command is doing an update that will never pass the verify()
condition. If this happens, we shouldn't send 100s of requests per
second until we eventually time out or things come back up, so add
a simple exponential backoff with reasonable max retry sleep of 8s.

Closes-Bug: #1907836
Change-Id: Ib757f182a4c7fdf25ed9374963ac5210e4d35523
(cherry picked form commit 6596164f51217cc7fabf302ce14ccc9d9beaff1f)

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I1c457250eab70abcf717f04feb2d26ce34830d79

Do you think we should actually ship it with any ironic installation? I'd rather have it go to tools until we make something more product-looking out of it."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-04 15:41:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Do you think we should actually ship it with any ironic installation? I'd rather have it go to tools until we make something more product-looking out of it.

I dunno. I'd like to have something anyone has already in the field and can just run with the existing configuration they are running with to help provide insight. Having something else, that is separately bundled, that they need to go get, just seems like a headache.

If we keep it bundled, I feel like we could just backport it's addition and help operator's collect the information we need.

I guess I'm not looking at this from a standpoint of a separate product. We need information to make decisions, and we need to make it exceedingly easy. Unfortunately getting this information is invasive as well."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 17:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Add tiny little statistic collection utility

Adding a horribly written, just hacked together little tool to help
provide sizing insight into an ironic deployment's state and underlying
performance.

Key data:
* Queries the list of node from a pure python interface level with the
  database and reports timeing for the list of nodes to be returned.
  This information helps convey how long a periodic hits the database
  just for the query.
* Requests *all* nodes using the query pattern/structure of the nova
  resource tracker, and uses the marker to make any additional requsts.
  The data is parsed, and collected, and counts identified vendors,
  if any.
* Collects basic data on conductors in terms of running, conductor groups
  as well as currently loaded drivers in the deployment.

All of this information provides operational insight into *what*
conditions exist within the deployment allowing developers to try
and identify solutions based on the unique circumstances of larger
deployments.

Change-Id: Iae660aea82db8f1c4567ee2982595ccfdf434fe3
"}, {'created': '2021-05-21 22:27:07.000000000', 'message': "Add basic tools for benchmarking

Adds a horribly written, just hacked together little tool to help
provide sizing insight into an ironic deployment's state and underlying
performance.

Key data:
* Queries the list of node from a pure python interface level with the
  database and reports timeing for the list of nodes to be returned.
  This information helps convey how long a periodic hits the database
  just for the query.
* Requests *all* nodes using the query pattern/structure of the nova
  resource tracker, and uses the marker to make any additional requsts.
  The data is parsed, and collected, and counts identified vendors,
  if any.
* Collects basic data on conductors in terms of running, conductor groups
  as well as currently loaded drivers in the deployment.

All of this information provides operational insight into *what*
conditions exist within the deployment allowing developers to try
and identify solutions based on the unique circumstances of larger
deployments.

Also adds a utility to generate and semi-randomize data to allow us to
create a benchmark job in CI.

Change-Id: Iae660aea82db8f1c4567ee2982595ccfdf434fe3

  The data is parsed, and collected, and counts identified vendors,
  if any.
* Collects basic data on conductors in terms of running, conductor groups
  as well as currently loaded drivers in the deployment.

All of this information provides operational insight into *what*
conditions exist within the deployment allowing developers to try
and identify solutions based on the unique circumstances of larger
deployments.

Also adds a utility to generate and semi-randomize data to allow us to
create a benchmark job in CI.

Change-Id: Iae660aea82db8f1c4567ee2982595ccfdf434fe3
"}]
commit_message:
Add basic tools for benchmarking

Adds a horribly written, just hacked together little tool to help
provide sizing insight into an ironic deployment's state and underlying
performance.

Key data:
* Queries the list of node from a pure python interface level with the
  database and reports timeing for the list of nodes to be returned.
  This information helps convey how long a periodic hits the database
  just for the query.
* Requests *all* nodes using the query pattern/structure of the nova
  resource tracker, and uses the marker to make any additional requsts.
  The data is parsed, and collected, and counts identified vendors,
  if any.
* Collects basic data on conductors in terms of running, conductor groups
  as well as currently loaded drivers in the deployment.

All of this information provides operational insight into *what*
conditions exist within the deployment allowing developers to try
and identify solutions based on the unique circumstances of larger
deployments.

Also adds a utility to generate and semi-randomize data to allow us to
create a benchmark job in CI.

Change-Id: Iae660aea82db8f1c4567ee2982595ccfdf434fe3

commit_message:
Don't spam retries 100s of times a second

We can get a TRY_AGAIN because the DB is down or because the
a command is doing an update that will never pass the verify()
condition. If this happens, we shouldn't send 100s of requests per
second until we eventually time out or things come back up, so add
a simple exponential backoff with reasonable max retry sleep of 8s.

Closes-Bug: #1907836
Change-Id: Ib757f182a4c7fdf25ed9374963ac5210e4d35523
(cherry picked form commit 6596164f51217cc7fabf302ce14ccc9d9beaff1f)

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: Id2c4f09b15bfa184113a83f1eb3e825d7fe43129

commit_message:
libvirt: pin edk2-ovmf

edk2-ovmf introduced a bug [1] and results libvirt/qemu errors
It's going to be fixed in next rebase to libvirt 7.4.0 - but let's pin for now.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1961558#c10

Change-Id: I0cb0512ef40c48353d582b1c37a446f251b79ac7

Are those devstack functions needed when deploying cinderlib only? Because cinder doesn't need cinderlib, so if those are needed to test RBAC on cinder, they should go in devstack."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-03 04:27:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Is there another place where cinder uses the tempest plugin architecture to setup optional functionality?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-03 08:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

As far as I know, no other place but devstack. I guess that's the curse of the projects formerly known as "core openstack"...'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-03-03 08:50:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

This patch is not necessary for Cinderlib, because cinderlib doesn't have RBAC.

Unlike the name may indicate, Cinder doesn't have a dependency on cinderlib, it's the other way around.  Cinderlib is a library that allows programs to use the Cinder drivers without running the cinder services."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-04 14:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

yeah, let's do it in devstack side, like I am trying for nova - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/613251"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-26 13:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Add support for deploying and testing secure RBAC

This commit adds a couple of functions to devstack's plugin to set
necessary oslo.policy configuration options in cinder's configuration.
This is useful for having devstack deploy cinder in a way that uses
secure RBAC by default. We can also reuse it for a gate job to ensure
cinder policies don't regress.

Change-Id: Ic01c241f0bdd3b8543291a27abf89ad298865205

Same issue with extra nodes https://logserver.rdoproject.org/77/792777/1/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-ovb-3ctlr_1comp_1supp-featureset039/693f2b8/logs/bmc_1_34701extra-console.log'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-05-26 12:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

hmm, I believe the extra role uses templates/virtual-baremetal-servers.yaml, which hard-codes the config-drive to False? We may want to parameterize that template. But enabling config drive on the nodes we intend ironic in the deployed env to manage is problematic.

oh, it's the bmc node for the extra role that needs it.

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I0bfe5fdf3694232108e52b3bccfba950a2ecf15b

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ia712d170740c748002aa44d921ade8750997f8f0

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I4c18653c53a7d0b26b05a25757721879c0131ff5

subject: Set ML2/OVS backend explicitly in the devstack jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27900, 'name': 'Artem Goncharov', 'email': 'artem.goncharov@gmail.com', 'username': 'gtema'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-05-13 20:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-05-13 20:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-05-14 06:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-05-14 07:41:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

If we really needed this, then OVN wouldn't be ready for prime time yet. How about adding a *-devstack-neutron-ovs job instead so that both variants are covered? Respectively, given the devstack change was just reverted, add a -ovn job first?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-05-14 08:42:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> If we really needed this, then OVN wouldn't be ready for prime time yet. How about adding a *-devstack-neutron-ovs job instead so that both variants are covered? Respectively, given the devstack change was just reverted, add a -ovn job first?

That's not exactly true TBH. If You look at e.g. https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_325/768210/3/check/osc-functional-devstack/3253d34/testr_results.html where OVN was already used, You will see that failed tests are tests related to the DHCP and L3 agent schedulers. There is no such thing when ML2/OVN is used. So those tests will never be valid for that backend.
Of course there are some other failures there which could be fixed by adjusting slightly configuration of the existing job but I think that setting explicitly ML2/OVS in case of this job is better/easier solution.
And I don't think we need jobs for 2 different Neutron backends."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-05-17 07:08:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > If we really needed this, then OVN wouldn't be ready for prime time yet. How about adding a *-devstack-neutron-ovs job instead so that both variants are covered? Respectively, given the devstack change was just reverted, add a -ovn job first?
> 
> That's not exactly true TBH. If You look at e.g. https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_325/768210/3/check/osc-functional-devstack/3253d34/testr_results.html where OVN was already used, You will see that failed tests are tests related to the DHCP and L3 agent schedulers. There is no such thing when ML2/OVN is used. So those tests will never be valid for that backend.
> Of course there are some other failures there which could be fixed by adjusting slightly configuration of the existing job but I think that setting explicitly ML2/OVS in case of this job is better/easier solution.
> And I don't think we need jobs for 2 different Neutron backends.

That's correct, in OVN we don't have DHCP or L3 agents. That's why we need to swap to OVS agent to be able to spawn and test them."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-05-17 08:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I still think that the default test job should also use the default devstack deployment, otherwise we will risk introducing unnoticed regressions there.

If we need a different deployment in order to have full coverage of Neutron features, then this should be a different job, just like for openstacksdk we have multiple jobs for additional projects that are not covered by the default deployment.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2021-05-20 15:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Set ML2/OVS backend explicitly in the devstack jobs

Neutron team recently switched default backend used in Neutron
by Devstack to OVN. With that backend some tests, like e.g. related
to DHCP or L3 agents aren't working fine. So to have still the same
test coverage as we had before, let's explicitly set ML2/OVS as a
Neutron's backend in those CI jobs.

Change-Id: Idf6466a59c6cf96be2f1d53e696f0564584fa233

commit_message:
BnR added error msg in case there is no inventory

Currently both the undercloud backup and the overcloud backup
dont show any error msg when the inventory file does not exit.

This patch adds an error msg in case the inventory file does not exit

Change-Id: I57b43a550d8baf23add7794150e1f8591f756275

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic682234b64c313cc09a6471f30f20dc1a7d49f37

commit_message:
Explicitly set jobs to ML2/OVS

Devstack is changing the Neutron default to OVN backend.
This patch makes sure that networking-odl and uses logger and
opendaylight_v2 mechanism driver and starts only the necessary services.

Change-Id: Iacffc8424e0e2b0385a52d4c782ab4065e385e94

can be configured to limit the size of individual share.

subject: sharding: Add auto mode to rows_per_shard
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-18 04:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-18 04:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-18 04:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

still needs tests.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-05-18 14:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Seems like we have two new ideas going on here and in the previous patch:

1. A priori make an estimate of the best shard size to carve the container into equal sized shards e.g. 500k +/- some adjustment.

2. Recognising that the result of 1 may be stale by the time we get to the end of finding shards, check that the final shard is "big enough".

We could just do 2 and stick with shard_size = 500k, so we might get:

[500k, 500k, ...., 501k] or [500k, 500k, ...., 300k] but not [500k, 500k, ...., 1k]

or we could do both 1 and 2, so we might get :

[510k, 510k, 520k, 520k, ...., 490k, 491k]

If we do 1, it seems reasonable to expect any final shard to either be small (some objects were added while we were searching for uppers) or just under shard_size (some objects were deleted). So it might be that for 2 a simple check that the final shard isn't 'too small' is sufficient without needing to get the exact count.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-19 06:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-21 07:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-25 05:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-25 07:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-25 07:23:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

This is just a reorganise of what I had up before. Just flipped the order and pulled the auto stuff into it.

Haven't looked into the grabbing object_count and then again to make sure things haven't changed yet.. because might be able to use that to do calculation rather then doing a count of what's left, as object_count is keep up to day by a trigger.
Having said that, the count is only called when we know we're at the end _and_ it only hits the name,delete index, so also not too expensive.

Can look into though if we decide it's necessary."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-05-25 14:40:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

I think we should and could avoid the repetitive extra db queries in the backend, and aim for just one extra query. But doing so means tidying up the final shard range in the callers, not in the backend. I'm OK with that - it just needs a helper method that sharder and s-m-s-r can call, and it avoids burying complexity (that we might want to make configurable) down in the broker.

While playing with this I realised that rows_per_shard = auto is not as flexible as I had first imagined, because it relies on a default shard_container_threshold. So I played with an alternative --minimum-shard-size option.

I explored but did not complete both ideas in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/792986

There doesn't seem to be any tests here other than for the option passing - I also put a fledgling test in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/792986"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-26 06:32:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> (7 comments)
> 
> I think we should and could avoid the repetitive extra db queries in the backend, and aim for just one extra query. But doing so means tidying up the final shard range in the callers, not in the backend. I'm OK with that - it just needs a helper method that sharder and s-m-s-r can call, and it avoids burying complexity (that we might want to make configurable) down in the broker.
> 
> While playing with this I realised that rows_per_shard = auto is not as flexible as I had first imagined, because it relies on a default shard_container_threshold. So I played with an alternative --minimum-shard-size option.
> 
> I explored but did not complete both ideas in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/792986
> 
> There doesn't seem to be any tests here other than for the option passing - I also put a fledgling test in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/792986

Yeah, this was origianlly the second patch in the series, and hadn't had much test love.

Great thoughts, originally I thought about just having it always on and working in the broker. So not triggered by auto and no correct_tail. Just start doing the right thing. In current sharding we dont guarantee the last ShardRange is shard_size size (because it most likely will be smaller). So maybe having the last 2 potentually not shard_size doesn't seem too much of a stretch.

But having said that, if we ever want to pass in the overload factor it needs to be plumbed quite far down.

Sorry lost alot of my day on some other tasks. But will try and get a look at your other approaches before I call it a day."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-18 04:43:35.000000000', 'message': "sharding: make broker's _get_next_shard_range_upper smarter

Currently when we ask a container broker to give us the next shard range
upper if just reads the next `shard_size` objects from the last and
either return it or if it's beyond return None.

But this can lead to tiny shard ranges at the end of a sharding
container. It would be better to read ahead an extra range and adjust
accordingly.
It does this by:
 - Get the next upper (first_upper). If this is none return it as we're at
   the end.
 - Get the second upper. If this exists then we can just return the
   first.
 - If there isn't a second upper we need to get how many objs are left
   and:
  ~ if the objs left < some value. Lump the rest of the objects in the
    same shard, that is return None as we're at the end.
  - If the objs left > some value. Find a new next upper that'll make 2
    better sized shards:

  return next_upper(last_upper, (shard_size + objs_left) // 2)

Change-Id: I48d855bdbb7dca46e2b1fd6054f9b5017c331685

commit_message:
sharding: Add auto mode to rows_per_shard

When setting rows_per_shard to 'auto', the new default, the sharder will
adjust the last 2 shard_ranges to make sure the last shards isn't too
small. It does this by making broker's _get_next_shard_range_upper smarter

Currently when we ask a container broker to give us the next shard range
upper if just reads the next `shard_size` objects from the last and
either return it or if it's beyond return None.

But this can lead to tiny shard ranges at the end of a sharding
container. It would be better to read ahead an extra range and adjust
accordingly. To make this happen the broker's find_shard_ranges has
grown a correct_tail flag, that when set:
 - Get the next upper (first_upper). If this is none return it as we're at
   the end.
 - Get the second upper. If this exists then we can just return the
   first.
 - If there isn't a second upper we need to get how many objs are left
   and:
  ~ if the objs left < some value. Lump the rest of the objects in the
    same shard, that is return None as we're at the end.
  - If the objs left > some value. Find a new next upper that'll make 2
    better sized shards:

  return next_upper(last_upper, (shard_size + objs_left) // 2)

Change-Id: I48d855bdbb7dca46e2b1fd6054f9b5017c331685

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 23:20:40.000000000', 'message': "[ci] fix neutron services in functional job

OVN is now enabled by default as a neutron ml2 backend,
so lets adjust the services enabled to match that
of devstack and avoid validation errors:

lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:ovn_sanity_check:365 :   die 365 'The q-agt/neutron-agt service must be disabled with OVN.'

Change-Id: I9a0491a985fb6c36948e41419f94333ddf5d35a3
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[ci] fix neutron services in functional job

OVN is now enabled by default as a neutron ml2 backend,
so lets adjust the services enabled to match that
of devstack and avoid validation errors:

lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:ovn_sanity_check:365 :   die 365 'The q-agt/neutron-agt service must be disabled with OVN.'

Change-Id: I9a0491a985fb6c36948e41419f94333ddf5d35a3
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-21 18:41:23.000000000', 'message': 'tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
(cherry picked from commit 77530136f13f1fc0d8625d43e1689427d4ee2fad)
'}]
commit_message:
tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
(cherry picked from commit 77530136f13f1fc0d8625d43e1689427d4ee2fad)

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I599d4ea430cc1e65bb50d0481617b005febf6de2
(cherry picked from commit ee641dffc9b2ac835530efade91b1b72cee12e89)

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints for docs jobs

Looks like there are some issues with too-new-Sphinx and the PDF docs
builds.

Also, get devstack installing on bionic again for our py2 func test job.

Change-Id: I633398054694fe6ba1e0de50278f274daf69fefd

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I346aadcc6916c1a9f5202d7194def80d37ff2ff9

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.

We also switch memcached role to use infra tests to decrease testing time
and execute extra tests against infra.

Change-Id: I753abb5c569d07c64f2fd4cc4f3b09b28e60c479

with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I2587d1c6ec05d5a31a69143eecc16f7b84dce669

commit_message:
Missing mitogen module while building docs

"openstack-tox-docs" job is failing in tacker
due to missing mitogen module.
Error while building docs:
    "No module named 'mitogen'"

Mitogen is dependency of the pyroute2 and was added link to it
the docs in pyroute2 0.6.1. Due to the missing mitogen in our
docs venv, docs job is failing.
So let's install mitogen as docs env requirement, at least for now
to unblock our gate.
Later we can think about better solution as e.g. adding it properly to
the requirements or report and fix the issue in the pyroute2.

Closes-Bug: #1929088
Change-Id: Ie8962dc61a9512ec35f956b9e6a3497fb7f479d8

subject: Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
messages:
[{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-20 01:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-20 19:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

My initial thought on this was that I don't understand how this can ensure we are running with the tested runtimes for the release, as you showed in [1].

So I looked for other feedback to these patches [2] and saw similar thoughts in other projects, for example [3]:

"
I agree with reviewers in the other projects, where some said that "it doesn't make sense. If you run tox -e py3 you use the default python3 on the user platform, not the one requested for the testing."
"

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/message:%2522Use+py3+as+the+default+runtime+for+tox%2522
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/787011'}, {'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-05-26 00:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 01:03:36.000000000', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I3f0e2e3365c1e96aed3db7b1918b1abc51aa67c2
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I3f0e2e3365c1e96aed3db7b1918b1abc51aa67c2

setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Resolves warnings like the following:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I48b452c2413a854b8171814112fc31285728a0d6

commit_message:
Amend configurable-instance-hostnames to include response changes

We decided [1] to drop the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:' prefix for the 'hostname'
attribute in the 'GET /servers' response to allow the response better
match the request body.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2021-05-25.log.html#t2021-05-25T14:23:26

Change-Id: Iaf431781504a618e0379bd188335646f73ad4f96
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.

Change-Id: Ia1e4677d7e09bd74d57e9b48f606ddc1febf135a

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

(cherry picked from commit ee641dffc9b2ac835530efade91b1b72cee12e89)

[{'created': '2021-05-25 00:57:59.000000000', 'message': "Add librsvg2-* to bindep.txt

Add the librsvg2-* package to bindep.txt. This package has been
required to build docs since the Related-Change. The package is added
to a new 'doc' profile in bindep.txt; if missing, the package will be
reported by:

  bindep doc

The 'doc' profile is added to the tox 'bindep' env command so that, if
missing, the package will always be reported by:

  tox -e bindep

Change-Id: I6c60c31ca8002133ab77f05f59359b25315b299c
Related-Change: I26cefda80d3234df68d7152b404e0a71da74ab90

(cherry picked from commit f4ce3227761901b0e5b98bdf217ea4832ac0b96f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add librsvg2-* to bindep.txt

Add the librsvg2-* package to bindep.txt. This package has been
required to build docs since the Related-Change. The package is added
to a new 'doc' profile in bindep.txt; if missing, the package will be
reported by:

  bindep doc

The 'doc' profile is added to the tox 'bindep' env command so that, if
missing, the package will always be reported by:

  tox -e bindep

Change-Id: I6c60c31ca8002133ab77f05f59359b25315b299c
Related-Change: I26cefda80d3234df68d7152b404e0a71da74ab90
Closes-Bug: 1903038
(cherry picked from commit f4ce3227761901b0e5b98bdf217ea4832ac0b96f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 11:48:40.000000000', 'message': 'Block alembic 1.6.3 and 1.6.4

As described in [1], since #844 was introduced, when a table is
created, all columns "index" and "unique" flags are unset.

If [2] is merged, the "CreateTableOp" will set the flag
"_constraints_included" to False. That will honor the "index"
and "unique" flags set in each column definition.

Related-Bug: #1929518

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/848
[2]https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/alembic/+/2839

Change-Id: I90380b027cade633088099ae766ff5c116014cea
'}, {'created': '2021-05-25 13:17:38.000000000', 'message': 'Block alembic 1.6.3

As described in [1], since #844 was introduced, when a table is
created, all columns "index" and "unique" flags are unset.

In 1.6.4 [2], "CreateTableOp" sets the flag
"_constraints_included" to False by default. That will honor
the "index" and "unique" flags set in each column definition.

Related-Bug: #1929518

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/848
[2]https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/alembic/+/2839

Change-Id: I90380b027cade633088099ae766ff5c116014cea
'}, {'created': '2021-05-25 14:04:34.000000000', 'message': 'Block alembic 1.6.3

As described in [1], since #844 was introduced, when a table is
created, all columns "index" and "unique" flags are unset.

In 1.6.4 [2], "CreateTableOp" sets the flag
"_constraints_included" to False by default. That will honor
the "index" and "unique" flags set in each column definition.

Related-Bug: #1929518

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/848
[2]https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/alembic/+/2839

Change-Id: I90380b027cade633088099ae766ff5c116014cea
'}]
commit_message:
Block alembic 1.6.3

As described in [1], since #844 was introduced, when a table is
created, all columns "index" and "unique" flags are unset.

In 1.6.4 [2], "CreateTableOp" sets the flag
"_constraints_included" to False by default. That will honor
the "index" and "unique" flags set in each column definition.

Related-Bug: #1929518

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/848
[2]https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/alembic/+/2839

Change-Id: I90380b027cade633088099ae766ff5c116014cea

Still no builds for nfs-ganesha in download.ceph.com for Ubuntu (which would be the preferred way to consume this packages). The community ppa's don't provide packages for nfs-ganesha-3.0 microversions (3.3, 3.5) we can consume. And there are no nfs-ganesha builds in shaman for ubuntu focal. Seems the best we can do right now is to default to the latest build available for Ubuntu for 3.* (right now that is 3.5). This means that we will be testing Pacific and Octopus with 3.5."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-28 16:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-05-10 18:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-05-10 21:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-05-10 21:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Bump up Ceph to Pacific and Ganesha to v3.5

This will change the version of Ceph from Octopus to Pacific and,
with it, the version of Ganesha from v3.3 to v3.5 which is the
version shipped into the Ceph Pacific container.

Change-Id: I1b31ef9dd13e1d56284f8d9f8be03e3fee0eb0a7

commit_message:
s3api: Fix blank delimiter handling

Real AWS only includes an empty delimiter element when doing a
version-aware listing.

Change-Id: Id246a157c576eac93375be084ada3740f1e09793
Closes-Bug: #1853663

commit_message:
Keep stable unit test job in supported nodeset

Recently base jobs in opendev are moved to Ubutnu Focal
nodeset which made devstack unit test job start running
on Ubuntu Focal even on stable branch supporting old
distro version and start failing[1].

- https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22focal-default%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/1436d26e723741b78d5dfd1941d1ccd1

Change-Id: Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

[{'created': '2021-05-25 17:55:56.000000000', 'message': 'Keep stable unit test job in supported nodeset

Recently base jobs in opendev are moved to Ubutnu Focal
nodeset which made devstack unit test job start running
on Ubuntu Focal even on stable branch supporting old
distro version and start failing[1].

- https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22focal-default%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/1436d26e723741b78d5dfd1941d1ccd1

Change-Id: Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

commit_message:
Keep stable unit test job in supported nodeset

Recently base jobs in opendev are moved to Ubutnu Focal
nodeset which made devstack unit test job start running
on Ubuntu Focal even on stable branch supporting old
distro version and start failing[1].

- https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22focal-default%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/1436d26e723741b78d5dfd1941d1ccd1

Change-Id: Ib1ea47bc7384e1f579cb08c779a32151fccd6845

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-20 13:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'Make containerized deployment as a default.

Currently, by default, kuryr-kubernetes services (controller and CNI
daemon) are suppose to be run as a systemd services. The reality is,
that in most real world deployments we are using containerized services.
In this patch variable KURYR_K8S_CONTAINERIZED_DEPLOYMENT will now have
default value set to True, which means, that without even setting it,
deploying kuryr-kubernetes will be containerized.

Secondly, we agreed[1], that all the gate names should also reflect that
change in their names.

And finally, non working and outdated local.conf samples for
OpenDaylight has to be removed.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/apr2021-ptg-kuryr

Change-Id: I2c13893c80e9e5b3b2ac0cb64dd9bd9a40d99e63
'}, {'created': '2021-05-21 09:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'Make containerized deployment as a default.

Currently, by default, kuryr-kubernetes services (controller and CNI
daemon) are suppose to be run as a systemd services. The reality is,
that in most real world deployments we are using containerized services.
In this patch variable KURYR_K8S_CONTAINERIZED_DEPLOYMENT will now have
default value set to True, which means, that without even setting it,
deploying kuryr-kubernetes will be containerized.

Secondly, we agreed[1], that all the gate names should also reflect that
change in their names.

And finally, non working and outdated local.conf samples for

commit_message:
Make containerized deployment as a default.

Currently, by default, kuryr-kubernetes services (controller and CNI
daemon) are suppose to be run as a systemd services. The reality is,
that in most real world deployments we are using containerized services.
In this patch variable KURYR_K8S_CONTAINERIZED_DEPLOYMENT will now have
default value set to True, which means, that without even setting it,
deploying kuryr-kubernetes will be containerized.

Secondly, we agreed[1], that all the gate names should also reflect that
change in their names.

And finally, non working and outdated local.conf samples for
OpenDaylight has to be removed.

Behaviour for sample local.confs wasn't change: using them to spin up
devstack will still use systemd services.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/apr2021-ptg-kuryr

Change-Id: I2c13893c80e9e5b3b2ac0cb64dd9bd9a40d99e63

Store the 'name_upper' of the networks in the
network name id map, and use this name when
setting the port name in port definitions.

The port name is checked agains existing ports,
and since THT uses the upper case network name
when setting the port name the same (name_upper)
must be used here.

Closes-Bug: #1928711
Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Iac7f351ce9ee965c17b6bc2956d140efe25ffcf4
(cherry picked from commit f6bb0590178d5f51940154f8d69df59f462fb10b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network-v2 node port idempotency

Store the 'name_upper' of the networks in the
network name id map, and use this name when
setting the port name in port definitions.

The port name is checked agains existing ports,
and since THT uses the upper case network name
when setting the port name the same (name_upper)
must be used here.

Closes-Bug: #1928711
Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Iac7f351ce9ee965c17b6bc2956d140efe25ffcf4
(cherry picked from commit f6bb0590178d5f51940154f8d69df59f462fb10b)

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.

Change-Id: I97294abdb29266a0989b3399d5c25b32dbc39112

[{'created': '2021-05-21 12:52:54.000000000', 'message': "Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests

Change-Id: Ib0ca232bfdb6528fa7638c34c628406a9c6d8d37"}]
commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: Ib0ca232bfdb6528fa7638c34c628406a9c6d8d37

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,

commit_message:
Create ganesha-export-index before the ceph-nfs daemon is deployed

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,
to create the index object.
In addition, since the ganesha systemd units are managed by pacemaker,
this change renders the related j2 templates and prepares the ganesha
workdir in the ceph-nfs target hosts.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/roles/ceph-nfs/tasks/start_nfs.yml#L15-L31

Change-Id: Ie89c35238d1bb82a28d560d7f0f718f7ee38044f
(cherry picked from commit 6415174661f8690de738aceff4ad77c9d824cb6f)

commit_message:
Replace linters test with integarted one

We've created integrated linters check job a while back and it's successfully
working for several releases. At the moment we experience difficulties
with future maintenance of the linters check from the openstack-ansible-tests
repo. So instead of fixing current one, we replace it with modern version of
the test.


Change-Id: I5fd4c274a43fb161b6b5996c75d14de415e72d45

commit_message:
Fix minimum version of puppet-rabbitmq

The change 2ec2ee3dbe251c38164d01a3998fa5af55855992 updated minimum
version of puppet-rabbitmq unexpectedly. This change reverts the change
so that we bump minimum version only about puppet-openstack modules.

Change-Id: I55b3aedb8e47897b7a2fec2aa01769c65a46cd56

commit_message:
Support storing Kolla passwords in Hashicorp Vault

This commit adds functionality to allow passwords that are generated
for Kolla Ansible in Hashicorp Vault as an alternative to using
Ansible Vault.

Change-Id: Ibc874e59f63abe704239048fe3ffa8461bf7fa0b
Task: 42410
Story: 2008872

This does not explain the usecase well and also i think it miss understinad how resouces are managed in opentack.

all api resouces are create by useser but owned by the keystone project not by the user. so a user does not own a vm or a cybporg resouce when it assigned. those resouce are allocated to the project and quota enforcement is done at the project level. 

i do not think that user infomation shoudl be relevent here but with out a clear problem statement and proposed chagne i dont thinik we can make a reasoned desicsion on this spec. as such we should reject it by defualt unless the problem this is trying to adress is explained clearly.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-12-01 14:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Change-Id: Ib38b522ea49ad9b8ef31a84b4f9255c33bbaba3c
'}, {'created': '2020-12-08 08:51:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add no user token when get Cyborg client

When request from Masakari does not have any token info, then call cyborg
api would be failed.

So add user/project CONF with admin role at cyborg group, and when determine
context is_admin and without token, do authenticaion with user/project info
to call cyborg api.

Change-Id: Ib38b522ea49ad9b8ef31a84b4f9255c33bbaba3c
'}, {'created': '2020-12-16 10:25:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add no user token when get Cyborg client

When we resume guest state with accelerator bound, we should pass
the accel_info when the guest hard reboot, please see the bug(#1908383).

In the process of getting accel info, we should add no user token auth to
get Cyborg client by cyborg user password configured, or the VM will be set
error because of lost communication with Cyborg.

So add user/project CONF with admin role at cyborg group, and when determine
context is_admin and without token, do authenticaion with user/project info
to call cyborg api.

Change-Id: Ib38b522ea49ad9b8ef31a84b4f9255c33bbaba3c
'}]
commit_message:
Add no user token when get Cyborg client

When we resume guest state with accelerator bound, we should pass
the accel_info when the guest hard reboot, please see the bug(#1908383).

In the process of getting accel info, we should add no user token auth to
get Cyborg client by cyborg user password configured, or the VM will be set
error because of lost communication with Cyborg.

So add user/project CONF with admin role at cyborg group, and when determine
context is_admin and without token, do authenticaion with user/project info
to call cyborg api.

Change-Id: Ib38b522ea49ad9b8ef31a84b4f9255c33bbaba3c

commit_message:
Removed mentions of mistral from the doc

Also removed mentions of VF and validations in general,
as they are not relevant to this repo.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iae6df8f2eebc2ce9ae47d59b69215b47c15ff4c3

commit_message:
After SFTP backup, the backup file and the iso must be deleted from the machine

Currently, the SFTP backup leaves huge archives on the machine that the
backup has been taken. This change adds a cleanup task to the
backup&restore role. Also, to perform an SFTP backup, it is needed that
the SSH fingerprint of the storage node is downloaded on the node.
Although this could be done by hand, this change automates also this
action.

bz#1955495

Change-Id: I7b8df9cf8a56606f3db54f00af547378e4f4e472

commit_message:
Make clustercheck service accessible over socat

Allow clustercheck to be started on-demand by socat in addition
to xinetd. Make socat the new default as xinetd will get deprecated
eventually.

Depends-On: Ie7ede82a755e729d66e077f97e87b3d6c816ed3c
Change-Id: I7d87b5861a576cf4849a25cd1d3f5e77568de1e4
Closes-Bug: #1928693

[{'created': '2021-03-18 10:21:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia070423bd9d26695d6916c6e11de8b7650356002
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia070423bd9d26695d6916c6e11de8b7650356002

[{'created': '2021-05-19 18:04:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add bindep.txt for ansible-builder

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Add pool delete support for Ceph pools

Two new values, "delete" and "delete_all_pool_data," have been
added to the Ceph pool spec to allow existing pools to be deleted
in a brownfield deployment. For deployments where a pool does not
exist, either for greenfield or because it has been deleted
previously, the pool will be created and then deleted in a single
step.

Change-Id: Ic22acf02ae2e02e03b834e187d8a6a1fa58249e7

cards.

Hello Sean. Can you please explain your previous review? And if other hypervisors can perform hot resize, why not add it as a feature?'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2014-12-18 18:21:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

My concern would be that while most hypervisors support some variation of a hot 'resize' (add/remove vCPUs, RAM, disks, etc.) there seems to be a lot of discrepancies in terms of what combination of these is supported in each, and what caveats apply (seems based on the spec the same is true for Hyper-V). If there is to be a common action for hot-resize then I would expect it to behave consistently across the virt drivers (or as many as is feasible).

Has there been any discussion on the list about trying to build a matrix of what's actually feasible for each driver if we were to go down this path? Apologies if this came up in the previous round Sean refers to..."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-01-29 00:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

please resubmit for L

I think we probably need that matrix reported before we could approve this.

I think we could be more flexible with resize and making it live, but we might need to be able to expose some capabilities around what would be possible to resize live. In Xen it can depend on the instance.

I would be OK if all hypervisors can fall back to "expose extra resources" after next reboot, but I have no idea if that is generally true.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-03-17 23:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-03-17 23:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Reproposed for Liberty. Also included a support matrix in the spec.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-03-17 23:13:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Also, an idea would be to include an image property, named 'supports_live_resize', meaning that the guest supports this feature as well.

Also, @John, I don't think I understand what you mean with the last line of your comment.."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-17 23:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2015-04-16 17:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-04-16 23:26:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)

Hello, thanks for the reviews! I'll upload a new patchset, fixing the typos and suggestions by jichenjc. I will also include the minimum driver version required for this feature."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-04-17 09:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

I like the general approach here.

Long term I want to add live-migrate and resize together, which is why I keep going on about it here, but I don't want to block this feature on getting the live-migrate part added. This is a good first step.

The main thing, is I think we should reword this as the first step towards a full live-resize picture (we might want a dev ref document for that), where migrate, resize and live-migrate all share the same code path. If live-resize uses live-migrate to move the VM, we can look at a zero move live-migrate as a resize.

The alternative we need to look at his, is instead of adding "live" to resize, we could add resize to "live-migrate". While this is quicker, it may well be a lost opportunity to unify things.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-05-12 18:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-12 18:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1
