Joe raised some interesting points, there are a couple of things I will have to look into.

Another question that was raised is if we could force the live resize to the same host, if possible? That would require adding another flag to the current resize API (let's say --same-host). Since that flag would be relevant in Phase II, I'm wondering if we should add that flag in the same microversion as the --live flag, or a separate one. I'm currently in favour of the 1st option."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-06-22 13:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I think the force to same host thing should be dealt with independently of live-resize, its just mixing too many things together, I feel.'}, {'account_id': 7664, 'date': '2015-06-22 23:42:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@John - regarding resize to same host, do you want me to bring these [1,2] back to life?

Dan had originally requested to have [1] be part of this spec, but I would be happy to bring it back to the table if you feel that's more appropriate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175115/
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/flexible-resize-behavior

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-08-06 13:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Apologies this vote is late, but as announced on the ML we are not longer accepting specs for Liberty, as of June 25th 2015, and we have now completed the exception process for Liberty.
However, we are now open for Mitaka specs (with the hope to get most reviewed and merged before the summit). Please move this spec to the Mitaka directory.
For more details, please see: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova/Liberty_Release_Schedule#Spec_and_Blueprint_Approval_Freeze
Any questions, please email me or find me on IRC johnthetubaguy'}, {'account_id': 13997, 'date': '2015-09-06 04:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Abandoning this as Liberty specs closed on June 25th 2015, and the nova team is getting ready for Mitaka.

If you're still interested in seeing this in nova please restore the change and rebase into specs/mitaka/approved.

Sorry to get to this so very late.

This seems very close, and it has gained support for folks wanting to implement the libvirt side, which is great.

I like splitting this into two phases, so we make some progress.

I worry about resize confirm/revert, I don't think it makes sense in this context. Maybe this means this should be its own new API? I am not sure."}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-12-03 18:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(9 comments)

Thanks John for the review! Yeah, there is a lot of desire to add this feature, a lot of people offered to help implement this feature in their own respective drivers, not only libvirt. :)

It would make sense for this feature to have its own API, the implementation would be simpler, it would be easier to change the policy for this feature, etc.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-12-07 07:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-12-07 07:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified+1

So I actually think this makes more sense than the current resize operation, so I quite like the idea, even if it is totally to do with pet VMs.

I have some issues with the spec, but given the deadline, they really are mostly implementation details, or at least, things easiest to agree when looking at the code in gerrit, rather than a textual description.

The big strokes seem sound, so I am OK with this. I do worry no one will ever implement phase II, but I think leaving that till next release is a wise move here.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-12-10 14:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Thanks John! As for Phase II, I'll take care of that, so, no worries. :)"}, {'account_id': 9775, 'date': '2015-12-10 14:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

Sorry about getting late to this one. I have a question for one of the developers who plans to do it for Libvirt. Even though it is probably a driver specific discussion but then it seems like Libvirt needs something like a maxMemory and set of dim slots during the boot of the VM, which would indicate how much maximum memory can be allotted to the VM and how many dim slots are there in total to plug the memory for the VMs respectively. http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html (Look for maxMemory on this one). I am curious if the general implementation of this feature would need anything else as a part of the flavor specifications to make it work for libvirt.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2015-12-10 15:17:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

It is a libvirt implementation detail, maxMemory must be set beforehand for the VM, in order to be capable of memory live-resize. This can be specified as a flavor extra_spec. We could amend this specific detail in the spec, if necessary, after it merges, or at least this should be mentioned in the release notes when it's ready. Thanks Sudipta for bringing it up!"}, {'account_id': 9775, 'date': '2015-12-10 15:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Sounded like extra-specs. Thanks Claudio :) All the best with the merge!'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2015-12-11 10:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2015-12-11 21:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

Hello Bob, thanks for the comment! Of course, I will submit an amend after the spec is approved, in order to address the comments. The purpose of the support matrix included in the spec is to showcase the minimum hypervisor version required for this feature; it doesn't mean that this feature will only be available for those versions. Newer versions are definitely going to be supported. From what I could find out online, live-resize support for XenServer was introduced in 5.5.0, which is why it is mentioned in the matrix. :)"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2015-12-14 05:57:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

I think if the is boot from volume, its root_disk need to be extended by cinder, not nova, so you can use cinder api[1] to resize the in-use volume by instance. But the server's cpu and ram can be extended by nova.

> This spec is old and needs to be re-proposed under the train/ spec
 > directory if someone is interested in working on it.

I want to do this work, but there may be some changes in the program. I want to add an attribute to the instance, e.g. supports_live_resieze, through this supports_live_resieze to determine whether the instance supports live resize, rather than having such a strong dependency with the flavor. Update on the basis of this patch? Or can I start a new spec?

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-11 23:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Adds spec for Hyper-V instance hot resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'created': '2014-12-12 10:34:22.000000000', 'message': 'Adds spec for Hyper-V instance hot resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize

In Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 a new feature was introduced,
allowing users to resize the VMs while they are still running.
Because of this, no down time for the spawned instances is
necessary when performing nova resize.

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'created': '2014-12-12 13:45:10.000000000', 'message': 'Adds spec for Hyper-V instance hot resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize

In Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 a new feature was introduced,
allowing users to resize both memory and local disks (but not vCPUs)
of the VMs while they are still running. Because of this,
no down time for the spawned instances is necessary when
nova resize is performed on the same host.

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-hot-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'created': '2015-03-17 23:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Adds spec for instance live resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-live-resize

Hyper-V, KVM, VMWare and Xen allows users to resize both memory
and local disks of the VMs while they are still running. Because
of this, no down time is needed for the spawned instances when
live resize is performed on the same host.

Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'created': '2015-05-12 18:22:47.000000000', 'message': 'Adds spec for instance live resize

commit_message:
Adds spec for instance live resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-live-resize

Hyper-V, KVM, PowerVM and VMWare allows users to resize both memory
and local disks of the VMs while they are still running. Because
of this, no down time is needed for the spawned instances when
live resize is performed on the same host.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 02:02:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add ensure-volume-attachment-successful.rst spec

Change-Id: I7523f994f5b393e056ae9820927159d548dbbdba
'}, {'created': '2020-10-21 02:08:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add ensure-volume-attachment-successful.rst spec

if the first volume attached too slowly, and at the same time attaching
another volume, the nova-api will send the RPC call message to nova-cpu,
however the attach_volume function in manager.py is taking an instance.uuid
lock for the first volume, and reserve_block_device_name function in
manager.py will wait the first volume attached completed to take the
instance.uuid lock to create block_device_mapping. And if storage backend
is dealt with attaching slowly, the RPC call in nova-api will be timeout.

Related-Bug: #1897424

manager.py will wait the first volume attached completed to take the
instance.uuid lock to create block_device_mapping. And if storage backend
is dealt with attaching slowly, the RPC call in nova-api will be timeout.

commit_message:
Remove RPC call to ensure volume attachment successful

This blueprint proposes to remove the RPC call in nova API to avoid attaching
volumes failures when attaching multiple volumes to an instance simultaneously
with a slow volume backend.

Part of blueprint ensure-volume-attachment-successful

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7523f994f5b393e056ae9820927159d548dbbdba

subject: Add nova-support-multiple-boot-volume-with-boot-order-selection spec
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 32039, 'name': 'Jinsheng Zhang', 'email': 'zhangjl02@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangjl02'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 32039, 'date': '2020-06-25 03:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-06-26 21:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32039, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@melanie witt
Thanks for your reply. Previously, we worked on Rocky about changing boot volume index of instance and didn't notice about the proposal you listed. It's our negligence. 
After reading "Detach and attach boot volumes", there is similarity. But our goal is to switching between attached volumes without creating image or shelving the server, which simulating a PC startup scenario. Although specifying boot order is not really necessary so far, it only helps to calculate which volume to boot. Maybe this can be a feature afterwards that giving server a try to start in order automatically or manually. Originally this is a niche demand indeed for testing a serial of boot volumes built by pipeline. 
Since the "Detach and attach boot volumes" feature seems not fully implemented as spec has shown and the topic hasn't been updated for nearly one year except for abandoning action (https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/detach-boot-volume). 
We have no idea whether we should propose or abandon. Look forward to your advice.

This is our implement(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737913/).'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-06-29 12:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32039, 'date': '2020-06-30 10:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@Balazs Gibizer
Thanks for reply. Originally, we switch system between volumes to do automatic test of these OS written by pipeline. In some cases, it is not convenient to create and destroy instances frequently, especially when creating or deleting action needs to go though other workflow. Switching system only provides a way of convenience. End user can change a different volume to boot rather than creating when lacking of enough quota for user or server resource is limited or in case of resource preemption or rescheduling. And rescuing an instance is an additional scenario of this feature.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-07-02 12:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-07-09 14:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-07-09 14:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-07-14 09:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 32039, 'date': '2020-07-14 11:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-07-14 13:01:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm still pretty unsure about this entire use case. Having multiple bootable volumes associated with an instance that you want to swap between to save on floating IPs is pretty tenuous IMHO. commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore and test-requirements.txt file accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox and 3.18.0 as the
  minversion for tox
* Add a new job, openstack-cover-jobs, to run the coverage in Zuul

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I20e029e46dddb3c8b0c9abed3ecb9f183507b489

[{'created': '2021-05-13 02:04:44.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported

Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I2df0f4f2dc34794517befe75b27ed86a4ade90a2
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I2df0f4f2dc34794517befe75b27ed86a4ade90a2

commit_message:
Add config-drive in parameter_defaults

We added support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances in [1]. Default
is false.

Adding similiar option in parameter_defaults will ease overriding
environments/base.yaml in ovb-manage role generate_template.yml[2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7
[2] https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/roles/ovb-manage/tasks/generate_template.yml#L13

Change-Id: I7bbdc80684147c72561c0434b3217e41bd2a0995
(cherry picked from commit b58913d865aa67fca78a73d22284778ba75f9a42)

commit_message:
Set minversion of tox to 3.18.0

The patch sets min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ie2f5a84ce27007dcc9581f4d0e832d875b072eb9

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I024b96e93f4262a59922d3cda72943962454fd86

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 11082, 'name': 'Kamil Sambor', 'email': 'ksambor@redhat.com', 'username': 'ksambor'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]

[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-06 22:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2021-05-06 22:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with Alex here, people in my team use standalone and are broken by this change, we should maintain backward compat.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-05-07 03:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> OVNStaticBridgeMacMappings must be used for standalone
deployments.

Commit message mentions above. I think the thought process was, we can get away by forcing standalone to use that parameter.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-05-07 07:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this should fix the issue:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/790204

Ideally it would produce a warning that ovn-chassis-mac-mappings[1] won't be configured. But that can be a follow up.

[1] https://dashdash.io/8/ovn-controller#external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-05-07 08:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-10 13:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/790204'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-10 18:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-05-10 20:53:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

*sigh*

I'm not sure how we can do this outside the service framework. The provisioning of these resources are too intertwined with the services enabled for the role and the service configuration for it to make sense to move it out of the service deployment framework. Ports are created for _all_ roles that have the deployment/ovn/ovn-controller-container-puppet.yaml service, and on top of that it is one port per bridge defined in the NeutronBridgeMappings for the role.

My other idea for this and the service intertwined VIPs (Redis and OVNDBS) was to use a hacky custom heat plugin:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/778786. An approach that was not well recived by reviewers.


Is setting up this thing manually for Standalone deploymends using OVN too much to ask?
It's just a matter of this in almost all cases.

  OVNStaticBridgeMacMappings:
    datacenter: fa:16:3a:00:53:01"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-10 20:56:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this needs to be reverted and discussed further as to why/how we do this.  I don't think having the end user define this is appropriate."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-05-10 21:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I think this needs to be reverted and discussed further as to why/how we do this.  I don't think having the end user define this is appropriate.

I wonder if we should have a top-level parameter to disable any neutron use in the deployment-playbook. Then tripleoclient can set that for standalone deployments? (Does anything like that already exist?). If we set something like NoNeutron? NoUndercloudAPIActions? ItsStandaoneForCryingOutInAgony? and just have these tasks noop'ed in that case?

btw, see also my comment here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/790204/1/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_ovn_mac_addresses.py#247"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-11 13:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I wonder if we should have a top-level parameter to disable any neutron use in the deployment-playbook. Then tripleoclient can set that for standalone deployments? (Does anything like that already exist?). If we set something like NoNeutron? NoUndercloudAPIActions? ItsStandaoneForCryingOutInAgony? and just have these tasks noop'ed in that case?
> 
> btw, see also my comment here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/790204/1/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_ovn_mac_addresses.py#247

Can't we just generate the mac mapping in tripleoclient and call it good? I just don't know why this is a thing at all."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-05-12 09:49:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > I wonder if we should have a top-level parameter to disable any neutron use in the deployment-playbook. Then tripleoclient can set that for standalone deployments? (Does anything like that already exist?). If we set something like NoNeutron? NoUndercloudAPIActions? ItsStandaoneForCryingOutInAgony? and just have these tasks noop'ed in that case?
> > 
> > btw, see also my comment here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/790204/1/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_ovn_mac_addresses.py#247
> 
> Can't we just generate the mac mapping in tripleoclient and call it good? I just don't know why this is a thing at all.

I proposed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/790932"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

solved elsewhere'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-06 22:04:39.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Refactor OVN bridge MAC addresses"

This reverts commit a120ada72e05a380616755d514a4bc81ea7ef227.

Reason for revert: This introduces an issue if OVNStaticBridgeMacMappings
is not defined. This is a new requirement that is not
user/developer friendly. I don't think we should have
to provide this manually.

Change-Id: I51d27a0150ddab885b4cc9f0373b1030608b4dba
Related-Bug: #1927556
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Refactor OVN bridge MAC addresses"

This reverts commit a120ada72e05a380616755d514a4bc81ea7ef227.

Reason for revert: This introduces an issue if OVNStaticBridgeMacMappings
is not defined. This is a new requirement that is not
user/developer friendly. I don't think we should have
to provide this manually.

Change-Id: I51d27a0150ddab885b4cc9f0373b1030608b4dba
Related-Bug: #1927556

commit_message:
Add config-drive in parameter_defaults

We added support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances in [1]. Default
is false.

Adding similiar option in parameter_defaults will ease overriding
environments/base.yaml in ovb-manage role generate_template.yml[2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7
[2] https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/roles/ovb-manage/tasks/generate_template.yml#L13

Change-Id: I7bbdc80684147c72561c0434b3217e41bd2a0995

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more

Change-Id: I71ccc6f4e42cb92fd574609f936e8e3a16f677f0
'}]
commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I71ccc6f4e42cb92fd574609f936e8e3a16f677f0

commit_message:
Raise maximum allowed secret size

The default maximum allowed size is too small for some certificates.
This patch doubles the allowed size from 10Kb to 20Kb, and raises the
maximum request size by the same amount.

Change-Id: I59d11c5c9c32128ab9d71eaecdf46dd2d789a8d1
(cherry picked from commit c59f2a6bbb83308de1598cebdc82197f2a148c6b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-17 08:48:56.000000000', 'message': "baremetal: Don't start Docker after install on Debian/Ubuntu

docker-ce on Debian/Ubuntu gets started just after installation, before
baremetal role configures daemon.json - which results in iptables rules
being implemented - but not removed on docker engine restart.

Closes-Bug: #1923203

Change-Id: Ib1faa092e0b8f0668d1752490a34d0c2165d58d2
(cherry picked from commit bc96179195de171a693b83405a472dddda596bff)
"}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Don't start Docker after install on Debian/Ubuntu

docker-ce on Debian/Ubuntu gets started just after installation, before
baremetal role configures daemon.json - which results in iptables rules
being implemented - but not removed on docker engine restart.

Closes-Bug: #1923203

Change-Id: Ib1faa092e0b8f0668d1752490a34d0c2165d58d2
(cherry picked from commit bc96179195de171a693b83405a472dddda596bff)

commit_message:
[nova] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ic0bca9ee68ccae7d0d17548d2472eb49c3c76968

In the vmware environment, if we create a volume from an image, there is no need

commit_message:
Fix the issue of creating volume from image for vmware

In the vmware environment, if we create a volume from an image, there is no need
 to create an empty volume, otherwise an error will be reported that the target
volume already exists.

Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibae773dd3bd185f74c37709ee396049d2b627b74

commit_message:
Point ipa-builder to stable/wallaby

Since ironic-python-agent-bulder has stable branches starting from
wallaby, we need to point all the older branches to stable/wallaby,
unless they're already pinned to an older version.

Also fix docs building job.

Change-Id: Ie752f2bd160a09b39e3ca6c2a76d194d6ae78f5f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 21:54:06.000000000', 'message': "CI: Collect a snapshot of network connections

A recent magnum bug (https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008494)
when running with uwsgi has yielded an interesting question if Ironic
is orphaning rpc clients or not. Ironic's code is slightly different
but also very similar, and similar bugs have been observed in the past
where the python garbage collection never cleans up the old connection
objects and effectively orphans the connection.

So we should likely at least try to collect some of the information
so we can determine if this is the case in our CI jobs. Hence this
change and attempt to collect that data after running CI.

Change-Id: I4e80c56449c0b3d07b160ae6c933a7a16c63c5c5
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Collect a snapshot of network connections

A recent magnum bug (https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008494)
when running with uwsgi has yielded an interesting question if Ironic
is orphaning rpc clients or not. Ironic's code is slightly different
but also very similar, and similar bugs have been observed in the past
where the python garbage collection never cleans up the old connection
objects and effectively orphans the connection.

So we should likely at least try to collect some of the information
so we can determine if this is the case in our CI jobs. Hence this
change and attempt to collect that data after running CI.

Change-Id: I4e80c56449c0b3d07b160ae6c933a7a16c63c5c5

commit_message:
Add support to use config-drive

Add support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances.

NOTE: config-drive is always disabled for the
virtual barmetal intances. This is already hard
coded in virtual-baremetal-servers.yaml and
virtual-baremetal-servers-volume.yaml.

Related-Bug: #1929384
Closes-Bug: #1929419
Change-Id: I1f6454363b5d8a5c325afe194ed1484ff618f729
(cherry picked from commit 306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7)

'}, {'created': '2021-05-25 08:59:35.000000000', 'message': 'Support forbidden template URL regexes

By setting a list of disallowed regexes for template URL, this feature

open port.

Change-Id: Ifb4910fc5629d977e5b89fbc81db14d56683139f
'}]
commit_message:
Support forbidden template URL regexes

By setting a list of disallowed regexes for template URL, this feature
can avoid malicious attacker guessing the internal address and the
open port.

Change-Id: Ifb4910fc5629d977e5b89fbc81db14d56683139f

commit_message:
Allow migrating PMEM's data

This spec will be make the instance support code migrate if it allocate PMEM devices.

Change-Id: Id858f50c3804f9d60e1e79c3c3a042d508667f5d
Implements: blueprint allow-migrate-pmem-data

commit_message:
Add socat listen backend to clustercheck service

Allow clustercheck to be started on-demand by either socat or
xinetd. T-h-t configures the backend to be run by Kolla at
container start.

Change-Id: Ie7ede82a755e729d66e077f97e87b3d6c816ed3c
Related-Bug: #1928693

commit_message:
Use internal API for Barbican communication

This is a partial backport of two commits -
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be and
I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785. It includes the
barbican_endpoint_type option, but excludes the verify_ssl_file option,
since openstack_cacert is not used in configuration files in Train.

Change-Id: I1c5790fd4717d12e8ff8ddbcabfa8f0ece8411e0

[{'created': '2020-11-08 01:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_sriov_servers.py
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py

To make the functional test working, lot of patches need to be
backported. The functional test is removed in this patch and
hence the conflicts.

Closes-Bug: #1892361

commit_message:
Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_sriov_servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py

The functional test requires to skip the capabilities of pci
device. This can be done by getting capability template out of
pci_dev_template [1] which is introduced by commit
b927748c257e705903c2aa0ffa47b19914e31ede. Not able to clean
backport the mentioned commit and so removed funtional test
case.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/b0a451d4289dae2086b730fde6b0c7b30f3da2e8/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py#L186

Change-Id: Id4ebb06e634a612c8be4be6c678d8265e0b99730
Closes-Bug: #1892361
(cherry picked from commit b8695de6da56db42b83b9d9d4c330148766644be)
(cherry picked from commit d8b8a8193b6b8228f6e7d6bde68b5ea6bb53dd8b)
(cherry picked from commit f58399cf496566e39d11f82a61e0b47900f2eafa)
(cherry picked from commit 8378785f995dd4bec2a5a20f7bf5946b3075120d)
(cherry picked from commit 73e631862a81e85fdf9305f3d15b201d780c8743)

[{'created': '2021-05-24 17:07:44.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0
(cherry picked from commit 337771143ba7c392665a14e8aa2434817d9e9473)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0
(cherry picked from commit 337771143ba7c392665a14e8aa2434817d9e9473)

commit_message:
remove the oslo_utils.fnmatch

Oslo.utils's fnmatch module was added to fix the py2.7 fnmatch module
who was not thread safe [1]. Python 2.7 is no longer supported so now we
can use the stdlib's fnmatch module and deprecate the one of oslo.utils.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue23191$

Change-Id: I94dcc34180d2b31ce7f9050d1a289a5793b5f26f

commit_message:
db: Remove 'cinder.database.migration_backend' entrypoint

We don't provide multiple backends in-tree and couldn't possibly support
those provided out-of-tree. Remove this knob.

Change-Id: Ia05eb6536bd4b2977358c0086293757091aa5e68
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-05-06 09:16:44.000000000', 'message': 'Erroneous formula of virtual free capacity

This patch supplies weight of max_over_subscription_ratio
for reserved capacity when thin provisioning support is
satisfied so that reserved_percentage flag becomes effective
for pools which support thin provisioning.

Closes-Bug: #1927330
Change-Id: Ifad639b29ef628d467011e50fbd97e4af820c4c1
'}]
commit_message:
Erroneous formula of virtual free capacity

This patch supplies weight of max_over_subscription_ratio
for reserved capacity when thin provisioning support is
satisfied so that reserved_percentage flag becomes effective
for pools which support thin provisioning.

Closes-Bug: #1927330
Change-Id: Ifad639b29ef628d467011e50fbd97e4af820c4c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-12 02:28:08.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I52921f9da9685f1599da090011153147157a7a91
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I52921f9da9685f1599da090011153147157a7a91

Wallaby has already been released, it's probably not a good idea to backport this."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-24 11:49:21.000000000', 'message': "Drop OVS support

We're no longer maintaining the Windows OVS port.

Normally, we'd go through the standard deprecation policy but
since the Neutron OVS agent no longer runs on Windows at all since
Wallaby, we're dropping it right away.

Change-Id: I54c681c29c80f1d537e38980f68717b72f6b215b
"}]
commit_message:
Drop OVS support

We're no longer maintaining the Windows OVS port.

Normally, we'd go through the standard deprecation policy but
since the Neutron OVS agent no longer runs on Windows at all since
Wallaby, we're dropping it right away.

Change-Id: I54c681c29c80f1d537e38980f68717b72f6b215b

due to conflicting dependencies. We'll have to pin it to
stable/wallaby.

commit_message:
Bump requirements

The lower constraints job is failing as Nova has bumped the
oslo.config minimum requirement. We'll do the same.

The nova conf fixture has been moved so we'll have to pick that up
as well.

Change-Id: I1907982ca8ffc81b2529af22a9a6fd4a55aecafb
(cherry picked from commit b85e6a2c903bde7da9bb465d3862e98c8953bc7f)

>

commit_message:
Bump requirements

The lower constraints job is failing as Nova has bumped the
oslo.config minimum requirement. We'll do the same.

The nova conf fixture has been moved so we'll have to pick that up
as well.

Change-Id: I1907982ca8ffc81b2529af22a9a6fd4a55aecafb

messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-14 04:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-05-14 09:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-05-14 10:02:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

(Rebased to fix merge conflict)

I like the 'auto' idea!

I'm not keen on coupling this to expansion_limit - the motivation behind moving to absolute config values was that there is one consequence to changing each option. That said, if we are going to couple to an option, maybe it should be shrink_threshold? We definitely would like to avoid cleaving a final shard that immediately wants to shrink into its upper neighbour. And I think it might be slightly easier to explain the coupling of the option in docs vs expansion_limit.

But it might be good enough to bake in some threshold.

Ideas here https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/791440

Does this assume that object_count does not change between being sampled and find_shard_ranges completing? If object_count can change as we work on finding shards then we need to bump it up by some arbitrary amount (5%??) - we cannot predict how much it might increase by."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-14 12:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Change-Id: Ie6ffe8411155251284fbbe2565578fb5128cbd70
"}, {'created': '2021-05-25 05:55:14.000000000', 'message': "sharding: Improve rows_per_shard auto feature

This patch adds an extra level of smarts to the sharder. Which will
check to see how many objects are left when scanning for shardranges. If
there will be a smaller range at the very end it'll adjust the
rows_per_shard for all yet to be found shardranges to absorb the small
shard.

Currently the broker only corrects the last 2. Every other will be
shard_container_threshold // 2, ie:

   500k, 500k, 500k, 510k

or:

  500k, 500k, 5ook, 255k, 255k

Which this patch, it would be more like:

 502500, 502500, 502500, 502500

Change-Id: Ie6ffe8411155251284fbbe2565578fb5128cbd70
"}, {'created': '2021-05-25 07:18:19.000000000', 'message': "sharding: Improve rows_per_shard auto feature

This patch adds an extra level of smarts to the sharder. Which will
check to see how many objects are left when scanning for shardranges. If
there will be a smaller range at the very end it'll adjust the
rows_per_shard for all yet to be found shardranges to absorb the small
shard.

Currently the broker only corrects the last 2. Every other will be
shard_container_threshold // 2, ie:

   500k, 500k, 500k, 510k

or:

  500k, 500k, 5ook, 255k, 255k

Which this patch, it would be more like:

 502500, 502500, 502500, 502500

Change-Id: Ie6ffe8411155251284fbbe2565578fb5128cbd70
"}]
commit_message:
sharding: Improve rows_per_shard auto feature

This patch adds an extra level of smarts to the sharder. Which will
check to see how many objects are left when scanning for shardranges. If
there will be a smaller range at the very end it'll adjust the
rows_per_shard for all yet to be found shardranges to absorb the small
shard.

Currently the broker only corrects the last 2. Every other will be
shard_container_threshold // 2, ie:

   500k, 500k, 500k, 510k

or:

  500k, 500k, 5ook, 255k, 255k

Which this patch, it would be more like:

 502500, 502500, 502500, 502500

Change-Id: Ie6ffe8411155251284fbbe2565578fb5128cbd70

commit_message:
Octavia: Add support for build_rate_limit

This change introcudes a new parameter to set the build_rate_limit
parameter in Octavia.

Octavia doesn't set a limit by default (the default is -1) but to avoid
boot storm triggred by some failure patterns like netowork outage,
the default is overridden by 1.

Change-Id: I21667af35f761eaf41281b032ede728327cf42b3

commit_message:
Add support to use config-drive

Add support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances.

NOTE: config-drive is always disabled for the
virtual barmetal intances. This is already hard
coded in virtual-baremetal-servers.yaml and
virtual-baremetal-servers-volume.yaml.

Related-Bug: #1929384
Closes-Bug: #1929419
Change-Id: I1f6454363b5d8a5c325afe194ed1484ff618f729

commit_message:
Change default network backend driver to ML2/OVN

This patch is changing the default network backend driver in DevStack to
OVN.

This is a long effort from the Neutron community that has been
discussed on previous PTGs and agreed upon.

A similar patch to this one [0] have been merged in the past but got
reverted [1] because it did break some zuul jobs. This one also include
fixes for such jobs and was verified at [2]

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/735097
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/775632
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/791117

Change-Id: I8c2be82f33ed9f6c36f5509b3b210ee1a38e87ca
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-24 13:23:19.000000000', 'message': "Individual content types for multi form upload

When uploading multiple files through the form upload middleware
it would take the first file's content type and encoding and wrongly
apply it to all the uploaded files.

This was because there was a shared 'attributes' dict for all body parts
which was (correctly) filled from all the non-file parts. The file parts
however would also set their 'Content-Type' and 'Content-Encoding'
header values in the attributes dict.

The content type/encoding handling made sure to not overwrite
existing values in the dict. Thus the first file to specify such a header
value would win.

Now the individual files get their own content types/encodings by
applying the file part content type/encoding headers only to a copy
of the dict.

The file parts' headers continue to be ignored if  they are overridden
by explicit  'content-type'/'content-encoding' body parts.

Closes-Bug: #1916017
Change-Id: I0a921afc481ef5b98cd5974c45d4b1d3e2a15731
"}, {'created': '2021-05-24 19:55:39.000000000', 'message': "Individual content types for multi form upload

apply it to all the uploaded files.

which was (correctly) filled from all the non-file parts. The file parts
however would also set their 'Content-Type' and 'Content-Encoding'
header values in the attributes dict.

The content type/encoding handling made sure to not overwrite
existing values in the dict. Thus the first file to specify such a
header value would win.

Now the individual files get their own content types/encodings by
applying the file part content type/encoding headers only to a copy
of the dict.

The file parts' headers continue to be ignored if they are overridden
by explicit 'content-type'/'content-encoding' body parts.

Closes-Bug: #1916017
Change-Id: I0a921afc481ef5b98cd5974c45d4b1d3e2a15731
"}]
commit_message:
Individual content types for multi form upload

When uploading multiple files through the form upload middleware
it would take the first file's content type and encoding and wrongly
apply it to all the uploaded files.

This was because there was a shared 'attributes' dict for all body parts
which was (correctly) filled from all the non-file parts. The file parts
however would also set their 'Content-Type' and 'Content-Encoding'
header values in the attributes dict.

The content type/encoding handling made sure to not overwrite
existing values in the dict. Thus the first file to specify such a
header value would win.

Now the individual files get their own content types/encodings by
applying the file part content type/encoding headers only to a copy
of the dict.

The file parts' headers continue to be ignored if they are overridden
by explicit 'content-type'/'content-encoding' body parts.

Closes-Bug: #1916017
Change-Id: I0a921afc481ef5b98cd5974c45d4b1d3e2a15731

Remove old deprecated Token clients

TokenClientJSON and V3TokenClientJSON were deprecated
very long back so its time to remove them.

No one in OpenStack using those
- https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=TokenClientJSON&i=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I7112c11085d646e17fa2beb792a0aeed0d56e66b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-21 08:20:21.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I416c61dddf1cc5989fa01bb11bbdcc52cddc66a2
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I416c61dddf1cc5989fa01bb11bbdcc52cddc66a2

commit_message:
Unpin cmd2 package in pip

The cmd2 package was pinned in order to maintain compatability,
however quite a bit of time has passed since doing so. This change
unpins cmd2 to use the latest version.

Change-Id: I2b9c8d4c1da91b55301d818861d29cccb64b28cd

commit_message:
Update all jobs to at least Train

With the removal of official support of all openstack releases
older than T, this change updates each job to at least use the
Train release.

Change-Id: I6b41d79495a74b1072995ae5036f56bfbf585c25

bot reporting in them. On the assumption that these channels are
truly dead/unwatched, stop reporting changes in them for now.

commit_message:
Remove gerritbot from channels with no discussion

Auditing IRC channels we log for non-bot comments in all of 2021,
there are some channels with none but which still have our Gerrit
bot reporting in them. On the assumption that these channels are
truly dead/unwatched, stop reporting changes in them for now.

Change-Id: I9625d58b7d64c7d367f86c139f2264019ef75d22

commit_message:
Remove misleading section from upgrade docs

The openstack-helm docs currently state that the openstack-helm
dev team will work with Helm with regards to facilitating job upgrades.

This is misleading in that we do not directly contribute to Helm and
currently provide methods for charts to run jobs for an upgrade
for instances where images are updated, the job is deleted and
re-ran.

Change-Id: If04367b6563ed36c3b3cde7a9cd4425b6795505f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 11:06:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP compute: Persist image id within the system_metadata of an instance

Change-Id: I55d66c3a6cbd50da90065f4a58f77b5cd29ce9ea
'}, {'created': '2021-05-13 11:04:35.000000000', 'message': 'image_meta: Provide image_ref as the id when fetching from instance

At present various users of instance.image_meta expect it to be a fully
populated ImageMeta object. However when the instance is pulled from the
database the ImageMeta object is only partially populated via
instance.system_metadata with a limited set of attributes such as
min_ram, min_disk, disk_format and container_format. This can result in
NotImplementedErrors being raised by o.vo as seen in bug #1928063 when
an attempt is made to access common attributes such as id or name.

To avoid the need to pass instance or instance.image_ref around to all

are provided as instance.image_ref and used by instance.image_meta.

commit_message:
image_meta: Provide image_ref as the id when fetching from instance

At present various users of instance.image_meta expect it to be a fully
populated ImageMeta object. However when the instance is pulled from the
database the ImageMeta object is only partially populated via
instance.system_metadata with a limited set of attributes such as
min_ram, min_disk, disk_format and container_format. This can result in
NotImplementedErrors being raised by o.vo as seen in bug #1928063 when
an attempt is made to access common attributes such as id or name.

To avoid this the id is now provided by instance.image_ref when
available.

The majority of the change is test fallout and ensuring that valid UUIDs
are provided as instance.image_ref and used by instance.image_meta.

Related-Bug: #1928063
Change-Id: I55d66c3a6cbd50da90065f4a58f77b5cd29ce9ea

commit_message:
network-data-v2 - baremetal provision networks

Extend the '_baremetal_provision' book to include
details on how to enable management of network ports
and applying network configuration to provisioned nodes
as part of the node provisioning.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/772977
Change-Id: I6d8f6447565779b5892d1b8c5c057c9a81a56df4

[{'created': '2021-04-08 09:09:12.000000000', 'message': 'Create ganesha-export-index before the ceph-nfs daemon is deployed

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,
to create the index object.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html

commit_message:
Create ganesha-export-index before the ceph-nfs daemon is deployed

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,
to create the index object.
In addition, since the ganesha systemd units are managed by pacemaker,
this change renders the related j2 templates and prepares the ganesha
workdir in the ceph-nfs target hosts.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/roles/ceph-nfs/tasks/start_nfs.yml#L15-L31

Change-Id: Ie89c35238d1bb82a28d560d7f0f718f7ee38044f

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 service clients

Cinder has removed the volume v1 APIs in queens
cycle: I03bf2db5bd7e2fdfb4f6032758ccaf2b348a82ba

Tempest does not support queens release so we are good
to remove the volume v1 service clients also.

Change-Id: I297f230de51e0ef4f35eb33ddbaaab53c230713f

commit_message:
Change image key name for blackbox exporter

This ps change the key name for the blackbox exporter so that
it is consistent with the naming convention of other prometheus
exporters.

Co-authored-by: Chi Lo <cl566n@att.com>

Change-Id: Ia190aa6730fab99d7fb14c53b538c72a1bc698ce

commit_message:
Remove credential_cleanup job in keystone chart

Before the various helm hooks were added, a credential cleanup job
was created in order to handle the cleanup of the database should
the keystone credentials secrets get deleted. With the new hooks
added that make the secrets persist on upgrading, this job is not
really needed anymore.

Change-Id: Ic9eb5d30784dd8a9f2f8cc719155b92bc7c1c6db

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-21 08:19:36.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

commit_message:
Fix name of networking-ansible/baremetal package

We should install python3-* instead of python2-* in CentOS8.
This change fixes the remaining usage of python2-* left for
netwokring-ansible and networking-baremetal.

Backport note:
This includes 260aa9fe292646f553467cc6b63475261fed9b54 which fixed
the wrong package names in unit tests.

Conflicts:
	manifests/plugins/ml2/networking_ansible.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_ansible_spec.rb
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_baremetal_spec.rb

Change-Id: I136a81cc857130b3befa5df204525bfa6c6f0206
(cherry picked from commit 34b5036ed8a1b7d7b50ec85484f496d861be57bf)
(cherry picked from commit ca266112909fdd15f1c90c2778238bb66ff6c491)
(cherry picked from commit b85b99dfac4fb29c136bba52779d32cef16cab3b)
(cherry picked from commit 3b9df8e4b043471d875b8c112e04634a02ca64f6)

All the code deploying OpenShift 3.11 is gone in this patch. There's no point in keeping it as current Kuryr is incompatible with Kubernetes 1.11 API - we moved to non-beta CRD APIs.

commit_message:
Use kubeadm for installing Kubernetes on devstack.

Till now, for installing kuryr-kubernetes and one of the crucial service
- kubernetes, there has been used manual method for installing it in
specified version. Over time it became a burden to follow requirements
and constraints, therefore decision has been made to use recommended way
of installing Kubernetes - kubeadm. In this patch devstack installation
of the kuryr-kubernetes and its dependences has been heavily reworked.

Other than that, OpenShift related functions has been removed, since
they were all outdated and non-working for the long time.

Change-Id: Ife21874c0a71ba07723094c0f880aabcf5825b77

Glance has removed the image v1 APIs in Victoria

Tempest still support Ussuri release which is last release
where image v1 APIs are present so we need to keep them until

commit_message:
Deprecate image v1 service clients

Glance has removed the image v1 APIs in Victoria
cycle: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/738673

Tempest still support Ussuri release which is last release
where image v1 APIs are present so we need to keep them until
stable ussuri is supported in Tempest but we can deprecate them.

Change-Id: Iabc02c4516c84b523c61b82a2a44ee0db73f21e4

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)

commit_message:
CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0

commit_message:
Skip device deletion if in a temporaty namespace

In "IpLibTestFramework" tests, skip the device deletion if it has
been created in a temporary namespace. It will be removed
automatically when the namespace is deleted.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I3936a17499efec8d2d8349768517d7bc4b65bdbe

Thanks for reporting Giacomo. I suspect you may have an issue with the alert generating component, Monasca Thresh. This component normally creates the Kafka topic that you are missing. Explicitly creating the topic fixes other services looking for that topic, but I suspect you have a deeper issue. Please inspect the Monasca Thresh logs for errors (currently via docker logs).'}, {'account_id': 33083, 'date': '2021-04-24 18:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > After cherry-picking this commit on top of `stable/victoria` in my environment, the errors are gone. Hence, I would propose to backport the patch at least in `stable/victoria`.
> 
> Thanks for reporting Giacomo. I suspect you may have an issue with the alert generating component, Monasca Thresh. This component normally creates the Kafka topic that you are missing. Explicitly creating the topic fixes other services looking for that topic, but I suspect you have a deeper issue. Please inspect the Monasca Thresh logs for errors (currently via docker logs).

Hi Doug, thanks for your reply. You are right, applying this patch only cures the symptoms, not the root cause. This is what I found in monasca-thresh logs:

```
+ exec /opt/storm/bin/storm jar /monasca-thresh-source/monasca-thresh-stable-victoria/thresh/target/monasca-thresh-2.4.0-SNAPSHOT-shaded.jar -Djava.io.tmpdir=/var/lib/monasca-thresh/data monasca.thresh.ThresholdingEngine /etc/monasca/thresh-config.yml monasca-thresh local

 543  [main] INFO  m.t.ThresholdingEngine - -------- Version Information --------
 547  [main] INFO  m.t.ThresholdingEngine - monasca-thresh-2.4.0-SNAPSHOT-2021-04-12T11:46:41-${buildNumber}
 547  [main] INFO  m.t.ThresholdingEngine - Instantiating ThresholdingEngine with config file: /etc/monasca/thresh-config.yml, topology: monasca-thresh
 779  [main] INFO  o.h.v.i.u.Version - HV000001: Hibernate Validator 5.2.1.Final
 933  [main] INFO  m.t.ThresholdingEngine - local set to true
 1023 [main] INFO  m.t.i.t.MetricSpout - Created
 1044 [main] INFO  m.t.i.t.EventSpout - EventSpout created
 1184 [main] WARN  o.a.s.u.Utils - STORM-VERSION new 1.2.2 old null
 1185 [main] INFO  m.t.ThresholdingEngine - submitting topology monasca-thresh to local storm cluster
 Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
        at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:552)
        at java.lang.Long.<init>(Long.java:965)
        at monasca.thresh.ThresholdingEngine.run(ThresholdingEngine.java:107)
        at monasca.thresh.ThresholdingEngine.main(ThresholdingEngine.java:82)
```

The error seems to be caused by this patch (already merged in 'stable/victoria'):

  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/monasca-thresh/+/785379

In my scenario, ZOOKEEPER_PORT is probably not set, so Long() gets a NaN. Indeed, re-building monasca-thresh image from the previous commit solves my problem.

This is definitely not the right place to report such an issue, but it is not very clear to me whether this should be handled on Monasca or Kolla side (my guess is the latter). Could you help me understand how to properly report the issue?

Thanks in advance.'}, {'account_id': 33469, 'date': '2021-05-24 16:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Backport-Candidate+1

> 
> The error seems to be caused by this patch (already merged in 'stable/victoria'):
> 
>   https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/monasca-thresh/+/785379

Giacomo, looks like we hit the same kolla-thresh issue, I've been working on a fix here:

  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/791337

Re: topics, I just found this change after logging Bug 1928605... even fixing the above Storm submission issue doesn't fix the persister errors as the missing topic isn't created until an alert is created and used.

Doug/Mark, can I suggest the best fix for the topic issue would be backporting this change?"}]

commit_message:
Support explicit creation of Monasca Kafka topics

With this patch, Monasca no longer relies on automatic topic creation
in Kafka, and instead pre-creates all topics before bringing up the
containers. If the topic already exists then it will not be
changed, therefore existing users are not affected.

This patch allows per topic customisations, such as increasing the
number of partitions on particular topics and also works around
a race condition in automatic topic creation where multiple instances
of the same service could race to create a topic causing some of the
services to restart and throw an error before resuming normal
operation.

Change-Id: Ib15c95bb72cf79e9e55945d757b248e06f5f4065

commit_message:
Simplfy the logic to handle coordination_url

The default of the coordination_url parmaeter is now os_service_default
which is recognized as a true value and it is unlikely that users use
any false values explicitly to unamange the parameter

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I551f938a979c5921f204eca24fb3d16b9d47776d

[{'created': '2021-05-20 05:48:47.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I5b94727986da22c5cfc56a939ff3c4a14f009d2a
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I5b94727986da22c5cfc56a939ff3c4a14f009d2a

commit_message:
Allow overriding RBD disk cache modes

Keep the default network=writeback setting, but allow it
to come from hiera overrides as well.

Change-Id: I47aaf4be463684f5b67820b8ebb5db44ba960b44
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: fix formatting of the log_outputs parameter

Change 3f2e063c7894151df1a40dea6cbee9265b30cdb8 updated format of
the log_outputs parameter unpexpectedly, and because of that change
libvirt no longer generate its log file by default.
This change fixes the parameter format so that libvirt records logs
as expected.

Closes-Bug: #1929264
Change-Id: Ic92584431e0bf38bf4ae2a2479aa7999b343ae33

Unfortunately, the original patch didn't work [1].  Then a fix was
applied also without a test [2].  Unfortunately, this wasn't correct
either.

This patch switches to using filter_installed_packages() so that the
code is testing for presence, rather than absence, which makes it a
little easier to reason about.  Also a test is added to stop regressions
in the future.

[2] Ifef76eacd8bd837d2181ec75e406aa35f88b8b5b

commit_message:
Fix "Remove chrony in a container" patch with test

Unfortunately, the original patch didn't work [1].  Then a fix was
applied also without a test [2].  Unfortunately, this wasn't correct
either.

This patch simplifies the function, which makes it a little easier to
reason about.  Also a test is added to stop regressions in the future.

[1] Ie3c9c5899c1d46edd21c32868938d3290db321e7
[2] Ifef76eacd8bd837d2181ec75e406aa35f88b8b5b
Closes-Bug: #1929054

Change-Id: I93f53274bc8c7e62ebb8cb7bf81ff816f4bfd98b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-18 03:21:48.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I3d433b146f699e005aeef74cd763d95dc8a1b4bd
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I3d433b146f699e005aeef74cd763d95dc8a1b4bd

commit_message:
Fix name of networking-ansible/baremetal package

We should install python3-* instead of python2-* in CentOS8.
This change fixes the remaining usage of python2-* left for
netwokring-ansible and networking-baremetal.

Backport note:
This includes 260aa9fe292646f553467cc6b63475261fed9b54 which fixed
the wrong package names in unit tests.

Conflicts:
	manifests/plugins/ml2/networking_ansible.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_ansible_spec.rb
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_baremetal_spec.rb

Change-Id: I136a81cc857130b3befa5df204525bfa6c6f0206
(cherry picked from commit 34b5036ed8a1b7d7b50ec85484f496d861be57bf)
(cherry picked from commit ca266112909fdd15f1c90c2778238bb66ff6c491)
(cherry picked from commit b85b99dfac4fb29c136bba52779d32cef16cab3b)

commit_message:
Fix name of networking-ansible/baremetal package

We should install python3-* instead of python2-* in CentOS8.
This change fixes the remaining usage of python2-* left for
netwokring-ansible and networking-baremetal.

Backport note:
This includes 260aa9fe292646f553467cc6b63475261fed9b54 which fixed
the wrong package names in unit tests.

Change-Id: I136a81cc857130b3befa5df204525bfa6c6f0206
(cherry picked from commit 34b5036ed8a1b7d7b50ec85484f496d861be57bf)

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update
this at each new cycle.

Change-Id: I50b28d4f34acfd193706afb85d83d3d5d12a4a61

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 08:59:55.000000000', 'message': "isetup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I303e7f56eb192036c13dfd1f3a3526b77db76599
"}, {'created': '2021-04-28 07:03:14.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I303e7f56eb192036c13dfd1f3a3526b77db76599

Fixed bug and add api test

modify the get method inside the show_version to the raw_request
method in versions_client.py file for v3 volume, and modify unit
test and add api test.

Change-Id: I18232940577311a514c41d640e03ad7ddee08f0b
Closes-Bug: 1839794

commit_message:
Add test cases for Cinder nested quotas

Cinder nested quota support currently has no functional tests.
This patch adds test cases for creating nested projects and
then using those projects with nested quota operations in Cinder.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I8f36a75032f3191587398210b78b060e36f09794

commit_message:
[DNM] Count created servers and volumes

DO NOT MERGE PLEASE.
This commit adds counters to know how many servers and volumes are
created in one tempest run.

Change-Id: I1d1bc9591f71c11da960b0af5265aa2211791c1f

commit_message:
Introduce mypy

This adds the "tox -e mypy" environment which works
the same way we have introduced mypy in Cinder.

Files added to mypy-files.txt are validated with mypy.

Change-Id: I6d09422dbdf5ea58661aad7a63c4d4d7a2839833

commit_message:
Add devstack job to deploy all services on uwsgi

With glance as standalone(not running under uwsgi) by default,
we should cover some job with all services including glance
deployed on uwsgi.

grenade job run with glance as non-standalone mode but that cannot catch
the issues as it install ussuri devstack not master, so we need one glance
non-standalone(under uwsgi) job running on devstack master gate.

Change-Id: I151bb8b477b5f6b1f6c17e0b21feba6580af2172

commit_message:
Remove Monasca Grafana service

In the Xena cycle it was decided to remove the Monasca
Grafana fork due to lack of maintenance. This commit removes
the service and provides a limited workaround using the
Monasca Grafana datasource with vanilla Grafana.

Depends-On: I9db7ec2df050fa20317d84f6cea40d1f5fd42e60
Change-Id: I4917ece1951084f6665722ba9a91d47764d3709a
(cherry picked from commit 82cf40edf2921247dc09d304e579f46c4b5855b1)

when trying to pull it.

Change-Id: Ic0a5b9ff940c4971a74345b8812683b29c5cedbf

commit_message:
CI: add grafana to monasca image list

Without this patch, if there is a change to kolla in the dependency tree
then the monasca scenario does not build grafana, and therefore fails
when trying to pull it.

Change-Id: Ic0a5b9ff940c4971a74345b8812683b29c5cedbf
(cherry picked from commit bbc27b59f09f0118b2589d1111a65952f50ed6ba)

[{'created': '2021-04-27 05:55:17.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

Change-Id: Icf30f766231f4d5c72488a56131b04093c8ff03e
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icf30f766231f4d5c72488a56131b04093c8ff03e

commit_message:
Gather cron job definitions

Some modules like puppet-nova configure cron jobs to purge deleted
items from database. This change ensures that cron job definitions are
gathered as part of CI results.

Change-Id: Iaab678c1582ac67d890fcba06f7ca3790dc88106

and nodejs14 jobs running fine. So let's drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs
template because nodejs10 is already EOL.

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Iea2bdae065b4695c8e730abba4a5de43c1d75e9b
